text: Had a chance to try this today was excellent:) I heard from my spouse to try it the food fresh the broth wonderful and the dumplings sooo good:)

Family and I went to Las Vegas to take the kids to M&M's store and watch a show. We've been to Las Vegas many times and getting tired of the expensive but not worth your money food at the hotels so I searched on yelp for ramen restaurants, there I found fukumimi ramen restaurant.

We love eating ramen and for us that lived in Japan for two years, we had so many experience on eating different kinds of ramen. 

The restaurant is tiny but clean and organize. We were greeted right away when we got inside. The servers are very attentive and prompt. They got our order right away and didn't have to wait long to get what we ordered. 

My husband ordered the Kara miso, I ordered the tan tan men, we also ordered the chicken karage and classic ramen for our kids, and lastly my mom orders their chashu rice. We enjoyed the very tasteful broth of ramen, and our kids loved their food. 

We often eat ramen in the Bay Area but last night was the first time I've heard my husband said "this is the best ramen I've ever had in a long time" and for that, I thank you fukumimi for serving delicious ramen. 

We will definitely coming back if we are in Las Vegas.

This place is right up there with the best ramen spots in Vegas. Believe me, I've tried almost every place Vegas has to offer for ramen, and I'm confident in saying that the broth here at Fukumimi is the best in town. It's exceptional!! Definitely a must-try stop for anyone in Vegas looking for ramen.

I've been looking for a good ramen spot and came across fukumimi. I ordered the fukumimi ramen which is the house special; thin noodles with thinly sliced, super tender pork belly, in a lightly salted broth. Pretty amazing. I definitely recommend it!
Come here to try the ramen. Ramen are good but service is not that great. Maybe if the server is more nicer I'll come back

The soup was amazing, but that's about it. Noddles were super under cooked and seemed rushed. Tried to order in Japanese and got attitude for it, my bad every other Japanese place can either speak it or say I don't know how to speak Japanese without attitude. We were no even done eating and the server came twice asking if we were done as we are still eating. She mind as well kicked us out and ask for a tip. Still tipped her good for her garbage service.
The tonkotsu was amazing! so delicious two thumps up i would recommend it  :)

very good ramen in a strip mall in vegas. the karaage chicken is like japanese fried chicken and is amazingly juicy. it's also amazingly hot when it hits the table so be careful; i burned my tongue a bit. the ramen itself was very good as was the broth. i wish i had a ramen place like this in my neighborhood.
Taste nice. Love the Tori ramen n fukumimi one!!!

Absolutely the finest Ramen shop in Las Vegas! I have spent a lot of time in Japan, and the flavors just make me feel like I am sitting in a Ramen shop in Tokyo for Osaka. It was extremely busy tonight, yet we were seated within 10 minutes and our appetizer came out within five minutes, and our Ramen came out just exactly when we finished our appetizer! Perfect! Fast friendly service with a big smile! The kind that is extremely hard to find these days. Wonderful people and a wonderful restaurant! I Love this place,  it's the best!

Love this place!!! Oishii:)))
We usually have a curry rice, Karaage, tonkotsu shoyu&shio ramen which are absolutely delicious!! I like tonkotsu shoyu more than shio or miso.
Better than Monta ramen and Zen curry!!!
Service is okay.

Can't wait to eat their Gyoza~~~!!!

I was excited to try another Ramen spot in town.  With all the great reviews I was really excited.  We ordered the miso ramen and the spicy ramen.  I think the broth was excellent, but was not a fan of the noodles.  I thought they were very thin and boring.  Pork was tender but not the best i've had.  I thought the chicken karaage was very moist and tender.  Since this restaurant is not on my side of town...I don't know if I would go out of my way to eat here, but maybe if i was in the neighborhood.

This place was very busy when my sister and I went last week for lunch. It doesn't surprise me at all because the ramen is good and the prices are low. I got miso ramen and the only complaint I could think of is that it didn't taste much like miso. But all things considered, it's a great place to get ramen that's made fresh for a very reasonable price. I would definitely go back!
The ramen here is amazing. I almost died when I took my first bite of the chashu pork. The agedashi tofu and chicken karage were exuberant as well.
Delicious ramen...would have got 5 stars, but the service was subpar. Other than that, the value, atmosphere, and FLAVOR was fabulous! Will come again!!

This place is AMAZING! I had never had this cuisine before and we tried it on a whim recently (it is in our neighborhood and we wanted to try something new). I have been back 5 times in less than 2 months. 

The food was awesome, the staff is helpful and nice. I like the bar setup also because I can go in during lunchtime by myself and read my book. Love this place!

The food is amazing.  I went there with my parents and all of us love this place!  NOT 100% authentic but almost 100%. not too long time to wait the dish and the people working there were professional! U can see the chief were cooking. They have limited room and if you wanna to go there, you should be get earlier. Its very popular!
My rating is based on food alone. The Ramen is awesome! I only wish they had hot tea and maybe juice for kids. But the service was good. We will be back for sure!

Sorry Monta, I've found a new lover and its name is Fukumimi. 

The best tonkotsu ramen I've tried so far in Vegas is made at this modest establishment, located in a mostly-dead strip mall. The broth is marvelously rich and flavorful. The noodles are perfectly cooked, not too firm nor soggy and absorb the noodle base's flavor. The egg is amazingly seasoned and I've never had a yolk that was so buttery and rich. The chashu is a bit thicker than at Monta's, cooked to the perfect level of tenderness. You can appreciate the meat and its slow-cooked flavor in your mouth instead of just instantly falling apart as soon as you bite into it. At times I sort of wish they served menma instead of bean sprouts but its by no means a detractor to the ramen. 

The spicy ramen isn't necessarily "spicy" - I think the heat is there to mainly enhance the soup base and it doesn't mask the other flavors in the soup. 

I easily get full on a bowl of ramen (or any entree) so I don't usually get side dishes/appetizers when I eat out. Fukumimi, though, does offer a stamp card and offers free karaage after four ramen visits (and served to you on your fifth), so I ended up trying that. It was definitely not what I was expecting, the fried chicken was deliciously seasoned, the dark meat tender and juicy and the grey salt provided on the side gave the dish more punch. Wasn't a big fan of the dressing on the greens that came with the chicken, but my boyfriend really liked it, so there you go.

You'll need to ask for additional condiments if you like to add seasonings to your dish, since they're not provided on the tables. Interestingly at Monta I often reach for their condiments and use most of them in my ramen, but here I don't find myself missing them - for me, the ramen is that good as it is. Decor is minimal and clean. Sort of wish it was a bit more warm rather than plain plywood but whatever, we're here for food not lodging. Service is a-ok, no complaints there. Like many Vegas establishments, a gem located in an otherwise unremarkable strip mall.

All of their staff is polite and friendly. They don't have a lot of beverage choices, but it's enough if you just want a soda or water. Fukumimi also has two choices of beer. The whole menu is tasty. I've had the spicy and regular ramen, the rice bowls, and most of the appetizers. It definitely hits the spot!
Only took them about 10mins to get my water, let see how long its goint to take for my food.... service are awful!
I come here at least twice a month. It hits the spot every time! Service is good and the food is wonderful. Nuff said.
I had the tan tan men and kaarage. Flavorful, noodles were cooked well. I'll have to come back to try everything else on the menu!

The homie introduced me to this spot. We we been tryin to get here for bout 2 weeks. Work kept getting in the way though!! I'm kidding (sorta). Joint wasn't crowded, so I was pleased w/ that. It was clean too!! Those that know me know I am about that. Waitress was chill & didn't have an issue w/ us splitting checks. Some spots won't let you do that unless you spend $10 or more. I ordered the Fukumini Ramen & it was banging!! The noodles were thin just how I like em.' They loaded my bowl up w/ hella Chashu (sp?). My patna put me up on this Karage (chicken)!! Man, it was legit. I stopped eating my ramen & banged on the chicken. The lil side salad w/ ginger dressing was also legit!  I tried to be a lil daring & put seaweed in my ramen. Wasn't bad @ all. Next time, i'm goin all in on the seaweed, especially after hearing it has nutritional value.  Fukumini Ramen, you're hired!!

BEST RAMEN IN VEGAS EVER. Awesome staff too :)
karaage is also amazing. and the salad that comes with it is great.

I'm giving all five partially for the food and mostly for the customer service.  I came in during lunch and even though I was a party of one, the staff offered me a table or the option to sit at the bar. Everyone was welcoming and the waitress took the time out of a busy lunch to hand me a menu and not rush me to take an order. I ordered my fair share, and all of it was on point. Chicken karaage was moist on the inside and crispy on the outside. The kimchi salad was done just right, and my chashu bowl was layered with equal portions of rice to meat. Although the place continued to get busy, the staff never rushed me out or made me feel uncomfortable.  A plus for such great service and for creating simple and delicious comfort food.
Its not as good as I expected and it's kinda pricey for a ramen restaurant, as the usual ramen restaurant the line is so long especially lunch time

The tonkotsu broth was excellen--100x better than Monta or Sora.  What ruined it for me was the negi that looked like it had been cut with a spoon (green onion aloe anyone?) and the pork belly chasu.  Some "ramen people" are all about the broth or the noodles.  I'm a chasu guy.  The chasu was dry and chewy--like soaking a paper towel in the broth and eating it.  I think there were 3 pieces and I muscled my way through the 1st and could not eat the other 2 even though I was still hungry.

Staff was friendly but the waitress never checked up on us after taking the order (the cook dropped the food off).
Been to most of the ramen joints in Las Vegas. Fukumimis broth is to die for. Way better than Monta, Sora or Anime by far
Excellent Ramen flavors and the best karage chicken offered  compaired at any other ramen places in vegas area.

Visiting for EDC. Found this place for my friend who has a shell-fish allergy; and my hunger for real ramen. No disappointment and reasonable prices.

Edited: 3/15/17

Decent Food, TERRIBLE service.
I would give the food 3 stars, decent, but definitely not the best in Las Vegas, there are much better places.
What really turned us off was the attitude. My wife asked for hot water and WAS told RUDELY that they did not have hot water.
Really? A restaurant that does not have water or microwave oven?
Hard to believe.
Im not a big noodle person BUT I would go here again! Soup is amazing! Make sure to order extra noodles. The chicken is so yummy! Looking forward to our next visit!

We were a bit skeptical because the parking lot was empty and no one seemed to be around in site. But when we opened the door the place was full so it looked promising. great presentation and awesome prices! Glad we came
We visited this place everyday when we were in Las Vegas. I think the Fukumimi ramen tastes even better than those famous ramens in LA!!! Everything is perfect here.

Since Monta Chaya has closed in Henderson this is the next best ramen place aside from the ones in China town.  Place is small so if the tables are full be prepared to wait.  It's run by Japanese people so you know that it's almost the real deal.  They have lunch cards so the more you order ramen bowls you get a free appetizer with the 12th purchase.  Staff is friendly.  Chairs are hard.

I've never had a bad experience with this place, very kind staff and very yummy food, only 1 type of noodle is served though i wish they had the other types :/ other than that the karaage is very delicious and good priced and for every 7 bowls of ramen you get one free! Makes being a repeat customer better and better. The down side to this place comes with the drinks they serve canned sodas so for $2.00 you are paying for 1 can non-refillable which stinks but soda isn't the best mix with ramen anyways i always prefer a good green tea! I give fukumimi a 5 star silver rating and suggest anyone in the Henderson / Las Vegas area to check this out if you love ramen

Thank you

So I came here with Lisa R for lunch one day as it's near campus and fit into her lunch break.  Really happy she suggested we go here.

The ramen is delicious, the broth is delicious, and for those who don't eat pork (not my problem...) they also have chicken ramen.  They also give out loyalty cards and after your 6th visit (I think) you can get one of the choices off the card.  We got the chicken kara-age, and it was done perfectly.  Crispy exterior, moist interior, and they served it with just salt and a lemon slice, very simply done yet very tasty, plus it provided a nice texture contrast to the ramen and broth.  Overall, if you like ramen, or just want to try some good ramen, this place will not let you down.
This place is the best ramen in town!! Try the fukumimi ramen , you can make it spicy if you like, but everything is great!! the Karage is delicious . Perfection everytime!

New place for Ramen!

Location:  This place is awkwardly located in strip mall a few blocks away from UNLV on Tropicana.  Been here a couple times and it feels a little sketchy at night.

Food:  I always order the spicy miso ramen.  Broth is pretty tasty.  Unlike the other ramens on the menu they chop up the charsiu in this one which is a little wierd but it taste good nonetheless.  You must get their Kara-age which is one of the best I have tasted in awhile.  

Service:  Service is pretty good here.  They chef actually ask the customers if everything was okay which I don't see to often anymore.

Overall its a good ramen place but I wish it was easier to get to.
I had the Fukumimi Ramen which was said the best Ramen there, it was too salty for me, and the noodle itself was not so good enough. I was really disappointed because this restaurant has a high rate.
its a small space resto....got their own version of tankutsu ramen with bean sprouts and we extra veggie...good service...

My dinner experience with fukumimi was great!  There was no line, we were seated as soon as we enter. We ordered karaage, tonkotsu soy ramen and fukumimi ramen. All of it tasted just right and delicious. Karaage is like chicken filet, crunchy but juicy inside that came with a salad, love the dressing btw. Both ramen is delicious. Their broth cooked just right, not too rich and not too watery.
Service was fast. The toilet is clean. They accept credit cards. Lots of parking space. Though a little expensive compare to the ramen resto in chinatown...But I highly recommend it for ramen lovers!
Never disappointed. Their ramen broth is so rich and layered with flavors. Also, the price is great! So far my favorite is the kogashi ramen. Give it a try, it has rich almost burnt soy flavors.

Short: Good ramen, good variety of sides, decent service. Go here if you're in the area and not willing to go to Chinatown for Monta or Sora Ramen.

Long: "Not as good as Monta Ramen, better than Sora" -- is the best I can say of this place. Monta Ramen, IMO, is one of the best restaurants in Vegas. Being not as good, is a great compliment from me. 
The waitress was prompt, but we got our ramen before our Karaage--which is a bit odd, and made me think if she didn't get out order out right. Service was quick, but it also wasn't very busy that day.
I ordered Tonkatsu ramen with a side of Karaage to split. Ramen noodles were good; side-toppings were average (can't do much with them otherwise); the broth was good--but just not as rich as Monta ramen's. While also you only get a single slice of Chashu pork (unless you order extra, or go for a more expensive bowl of ramen). Karaage was to be expected (and served with a simple salad); chicken thighs fried and served hot. They came with a side of salad. But, there wasn't much flavor to the karaage. I couldn't taste much other than chicken, breading, and salt--while good, just kinda lacking in the ginger and soy sauce aspect of karaage. 

Should you go here? Yes, definitely. It's good; but there's better ramen places in Vegas you might also want to try.
Really good chashu and tonkatsu pork ramen bowls. Good service and reasonably priced. Will come back!
I had the classic ramen with extra chashu and it definitely satisfied my craving for ramen :)
Our water had a LIVE cricket in it.  Absolutely disgusting!  To top it off, they still charged us for the soda's we ordered.  Definitely avoid this place.

Hands down the best ramen in Vegas.  The tonkatsu miso is simply the most flavorful broth out of all the ramen places that's gone up/down in town.  

Noodles are very al dente and crispy, not soggy and clumped.  The karaage was awesome as well - super tender and crisp all at once.  Came out steaming hot - had to wait it out by chewing on some of the side salad for a bit. :p

We also had the spicy tonkatsu, and that's a nice change of pace from the normal soups.  Not exceedingly spicy, but just enough for a tingle and a slight sweat.  Excellent stuff!

Definitely going back to try the tan tan men next time.  But this is going to be my go to ramen place for now, even though it's a slight drive and in a bit of a ghetto area...
I have to say, the food was so so good! I have found my new favorite Noodle house. The service was great and quick. The menu was simple to the point and very descriptive.

This place is for people who are not scared to step away from the Strip.  Fukumimi definitely hit the spot.  The ramen joints on the strip are okay but it's going to cost more.  If you're having a craving, it's just a 10 minutes drive off the strip.

Unbelievably good ramen. I had the spicy tonkotsu ramen, very well balanced.

The kimchi side was uniquely delicious. There is a hint of sweetness, great texture and the spiciness is just right.

The real treat was the karaage. This is quite possibly some of the best karaage I've ever had. The very best was years ago, and my memory may be lying. There is a loyalty system where you get a free karaage side every 4 bowls of ramen ordered. A fantastic deal. I can't imagine ever eating here and not having the karaage.

My 4 year old loved their curry. It had a great taste and wasn't too spicy.

The interior is clean and tidy. Like most ramen places it isn't very large. It's a comfortable area, and the location is pretty convenient for most spots in the valley.

After the third visit over three years, I feel that it is fair to update my review. My last two experiences here were so so (I was not too crazy about their Tonkotsu broth) This time I tried Tan Tan Men and I must say that it is the best of the kind I have had in Vegas. I am not sure the chef has changed or I just did nor order the right ramen in the past.  I will definitely come back here soon. Also another thing to note is that they do not close at 2:30 pm to prepare for dinner crowd like other venues.
Excellent food.... However, the service is questionable ....  It wasn't busy, but it seem that the staff were preoccupied.

Bf and I both ordered the tan tan men, which was delicious but overly rich.

We will not be returning because of the service. The karaage was supposed to come out as our appetizer, ended up coming out after our ramen (wtf?) and it wasn't even that good. Bf kindly asked the server if she could bring us edamame instead. She replied by saying "we'll sir, we already made this for you."

Ok. I work in a restaurant, I know that's not how you treat your guests. She ended up coming back to our table and asking if we wanted the karaage taken off the bill. Well obviously, we only ate one piece. 

Ugh. Shame on you, fukumimi.

We visited for the first time last week. Tried the deep fried tofu appetizer, tanmen noodles and curry chicken. All was very good. Service was quick and friendly. We did have one small issue- I tried to call to alert them, but they could never tell me when the manger or owner would be there specifically. All I will say (to the owner/workers), having a fan blowing into the dining area may not be the best plan. You never know what it will blow into the customer area....please take note.

Went there yesterday with my friend. Ordered 2 Ramens and 1 fried chicken. Wanted to try this place because of the rating, and we were very disappointed. The ramen tasted so bad, I know it because I have went to Japan for many times and this is nothing like what I've tried before. Secondly, the waitress seems to have attitudes, no water, no greeting...

How do I describe my Fukumimi experience? SILENCE. And lots of it. 

When you're on a first date, this is probably not the first red flag that you need to run to the bathroom and call your BFF to call you back in 10 minutes with an emergency to bail you out. "Mayday! The night is going downhill stat! MAYDAY!" 

But if you were like me and brought a parent whose seen more than his share of bowls of ramen in his lifetime, then the silence is welcomed. It's a stamp of approval. A gold star. It means that the bowl of miso tonkotsu ramen my dad ordered and the bowl of salt tonkotsu ramen I got delivered on generous portions of noodles, aromatic broth, and some righteous slices of chashu pork. 

The service is here is quick and to the point, but not brusque or overbearing at all. They didn't ask us if we knew about their punch card, so I approached them after having perused a few reviews on Yelp, and now I'm two out of four bowls of ramen away from a free side of gyoza or chicken karaage. What a great day.

Sidenote - I had to drop my dad, said Senor Silence, off at the airport after our meal and we made it with more extra time than we anticipated. So an even better day.

Tried tan tan men for the first time. I never had it before so I had no idea what to expect. The broth is thick spicy and sweet. A lot of sesame flavor too. If you dont like sweet flavors,  I don't recommend tan tan men. I like their regular spicy tonkotsu and other ramen though.. Just not tan tan broth..

I go to Fukumimi ramen often because it is close to where I live.  However, I cannot say it is the best ramen in town.  The broth seems too oily sometimes and it is difficult to drink the broth which should be the best part..

While this place can get pretty busy and packed full, the wait is well worth it for a bowl of their Kogashi Ramen (If you love smoky garlic), Spicy Tonkotsu ramen, or even their Soboro bowl (sweet ground beef over white rice and delicious toppings). 

In all their ramen bowl orders you will find a nice soft-boiled sake and soy recipe egg, a few slices of meat (chicken for the chicken ramens, pork for the tonkotsu), green onions, and crunchy sprouts. As for the appetizers I would say the gyoza (pork dumplings) and karaage (fried chicken) are my personal favorite. Depending on the traffic the appetizers may be served alongside your main meal.

For those wondering about portions. The bowls are pretty moderate in size and not too small, but if you absolutely need more filling they do offer extra noodles if asked for a buck (you can also ask for more noodles after if you eat them all, and they'll hand you a bowl of 'em to plop right in). And if you aren't keen on waiting on a weekend they have a phone number to call for placing orders; which can be picked up once ready.

I love this place. A totally hidden gem. The ramen is one of the most authentic I've had, and reasonably priced. Reminds me of when I went to Japan. It's so YUM! If you enjoy ramen, you will love this spot.  My roommate and I go a few times a month. Highly recommend it.

Great ramen place. Food tasted excellent. Extremely reasonable prices. Authentic atmosphere.

Listen, it's a one dollar sign priced restaurant, so any review should be accordingly relative. If you want to feel like you just stepped into a small family-owned place in a little town in Japan, then you are in luck. If you expect dinner at the Crown Ritz for 2 for $20 then you shouldn't be a yelp reviewer. I love the fact that it feels real and not overly Americanized... no checkerboard tablecloths or backlit signs with pictures of all the food.

I got the garlic and onion ramen, my gf got the spicy ramen and we split an order of dumplings. It was all excellent. In both our ramens the pork was was tender (not boiled to rubber like a lot of other places) and the soft boiled egg was awesome. If I lived in Vegas, Fukumimi would be on my lunch or dinner list at least once a week. I wish more ethnic restaurants were like this.

Flavorful Tonkotsu Ramen (salt) and Fukumimi Ramen (extra pork). It is one of the best ramen joints in Vegas. The karrage sprinkled with lemon and a side of white rice is additional happiness to my appetite. But to complete the experience is to enjoy it with a bottle of Sapporo. Prices are amazing  

Customer service was awesome and polite. Got all what was asked and gave help suggestions as to what to order if stuck between choices.

This is our #1 spot for ramen right now!  My husband introduced me to this place last year and we have been going at least once a month since.  The restaurant is small and cozy.  The employees are always friendly and chipper and the food if always yummy!!!  I like to get the Tonkatsu (Soy) with a side of kimchi while my husband gets the Spicy Miso with an extra egg and we share an order of Gyoza.  The portions are just right and the pricing is good for a ramen place.  We have tried Monta as well as Miko's and this is our favorite.  We will have to try some of the other places as well, but as of now this is #1!!! ^_^

My hubby and I was attracted there because his co-worker strongly recommend this place.so we went to try it one late night.the place is a kind of tiny like home kitchen,but the atmosphere is good ,almost full of customer.we felt a little bit surprise about its good business,but after we tried one bowl of house special ramen and ask for another one,we figure out the reason.the food was so tasty and the soup base made me feel amazing.the only regret is after meal I felt a little bit thirsty maybe they put some MSG,or maybe the soup base is salty.another thing is the price is a little bit higher than we've tried like sora ramen,monta ramen.almost 10bucks for just noodles with few chashu pork,pricy for me. 
So you can try once a week as a change of appetite but not for everyday meal.
Still grieving over the closing of Chinmaya in LA. And today I am super happy to find this place has tantanmen .... And it is soooo good! Honey chicken garlic is also a must try!!!
freaking awesome ramen. The spicy one, ornage is delicious

When I came into the ramen restaurant, the Japanese decoration style is attractive. The restaurant is small, there are just few tables. The light is kind of dark, but I like this atmosphere. no noisy music, this is a quite place to have a meal. There are some remaining on the other table, which make me feel not that clean. The waitress is a Japanese lady, who is really nice and has a soft voice, which make me feel comfortable, and she gave me clear and helpful recommendation. the soup of ramen is good, but the noodle quality can be better. The food portion is a little small, but the price is fair enough. if you are not that picky as me, you gonna love this place!!

It's very hard to earn above 3 stars from me. But here it is! I lobe ramen and have been to many. Most are hit or miss But Fukumimi has consistently satisfied my appetite for ramen. Their karaage chicken is a great appetizer especially for children with less grease than expected and just the right amount Of salt. My favorite would be the spicy miso with thick noodles. Subtle flavors at first and satisfyingly bold after. Highly recommend if you're in the area and looking for a great ramen place. Staff is very helpful, courteous and patient so an extra star for that. Prices and portions are a hit too. Two thumbs up!
They're okay, good food. Have to call in ahead of time for an order and it's very small so people with large parties should be aware. They had trouble seating my classmates of about 15-20.

Their ramen is normal and not bad. But to be honest, I come here all the time mostly because of their kimchi. I've tried kimchi everywhere around vegas and theirs have this sophisticatedly sweet and nutty taste that I love.

I come back here all the time for this. Awhile ago, I don't know what happened but their kimchi tasted just like a sour store bought kimchi.

I hope the change isn't permanent.
the best ramen in town. TanTanmen are super super good!!! They are in my must eat list in Vegas!!!

This is probably my favorite whole in the wall ramen place.  The food is so good.  Some of my favorites are the spicy ramen and the honey chicken.  Gyoza is also very tasty.  There are quite a few substitutes and add on to your ramen bowls.  The price point here is spot on. Easy $25 meal for two. Can get very crowded here since it's very small, make sure you show up with your whole party if you want to be seated.  Only beer and wine at the moment, or just opt for a delicious green tea.

I heard so much about this place. So, I came by to have some Ramen. I had the Fukumumi and for  $9.50 I was a little disappointed. The broth was meh but the pork was tenderly flavorful. My opinion is that the portion was way too small for the price. Not enough noodles to justify the price. Its OK not the best/worst. 

Note: I saw 2 tiny cockroaches walking around on the floor by my table. Not a super big deal. I am sure it adds flavor to the broth.
Excellent Raman shop! We lived in Japan for five years and I became addicted to Raman shops. Glad to have a place near by ( three hour drive) where I can get my fix.

I love this ramen place for its convenience on a Sunday night for me and my friends to grab a quick dinner. However, it's a fairly small establishment and in a plaza that is completely empty so you'll never have trouble finding parking. 

I usually get the tonkotsu miso ramen with extra corn and char sui and nori flakes but that's just a personal preference. They also have really good agedashi tofu and have a stamp card reward system which is nice. The prices are all very reasonable and the portion sizes are great! 

Make sure if you have a larger party say 6 most of you are there before being able to be seated at a table they also have seating available up at a bar style seating area if you're eating for two

Tonight I had the tonkatsu spicy miso and the tan tan men with the honey garlic chicken. I thought the broth was pretty good and I say this cause I had better broths; more flavorful, with a slightly richer broth, with a house-made black garlic oil and garlic chips on top - a house blend of chili sauce and fresh chili for those who love their broth extra spicy. This would have made it more flavorful.

The honey garlic chicken was just ok, nothing really special. I would recommend they cook the chicken to well done then cooking with deep fried batter. And not to just use plan mayo, but to flavor their mayo blended with sweet and spicy chili sauce. I've had this prepared before and it was again more flavorful.

That's the reason I only rated it a 4/5 stars. I've had the same at these bistros before and better and this is my reason I couldn't rate it a 5. 

But overall I'd come again.

When all you hear is the sounds of some satisfied slurping, you know its good! This place has the best tasty ramen. Broth is flavorful and always hot, not too salty. The noodles are cooked perfect as well. Although the restaurant is small, authentic japanese style, and it can be a long wait on the weekends, oh it's worth it.

Fukumimi Ramen is a very nice ramen place in the middle of Henderson. One of my friends who is a specialist in critiquing ramen always raves about Fukumimi, so naturally I went with him to try it out.

The parking lot isn't as upscale as you'd expect, and Fukumimi has a hole-in-the-wall feel. The wait staff is very efficient and friendly, and the wait was about 30 min for the large group that I was in (~8 people), but you'd probably get in with a smaller group.

I ordered the Fukumimi ramen which is a basically their standard ramen with more pieces of pork. The soup base was very flavorful and tasty. The pork was cooked well. I'm not an expert in ramen so I can't go into much further detail about the flavor, but overall the ramen was very delicious and I had no complaints about the food.

The karaage chicken is like fried chicken but Japanese style. It was mildly spicy and marinated for flavor. It was a good choice to order the chicken alongside the ramen.

The restaurant is noisy as are most ramen places, and the tables were slightly crowded, but we made do with the space. The venue was clean as well.

I highly recommend any ramen enthusiasts to give Fukumimi a try, you won't be disappointed!
Great ramen! I'd say better than Monta Ramen  Great service too. Well definitely be back with some friends. I ordered the Sesame flavored ramen and I can easily say its my favorite now.

The best gyoza I've eaten anywhere. 
The honey garlic fried chicken...sublime.
The tan tan men, perfectly cooked ramen leisurely wading in a spicy broth made in heaven. David Chang you have some stiff competition, here in Vegas!

My first ramen, and the best! Since my first visit here I've been to other ramen places, and they can't compare. I loved the tan tan men. No other compares. I frequent this place often as it is just down the street from my house.   I also must add, it is cheap so it doesn't hurt my wallet.
Their Tonkotsu ramen was pretty tasty, especially the broth. It would have been nice to have the option to pay extra for extra noodles though.

While the Tonkatsu broth is not as good as at Monta Ramen it's still great. 

However Tan Tan Man is just excellent and worth the trip alone.

And in my opinion Fukumimi serves the best Karaage I know. (I tried at countless places) For me it's just perfect!

Whenever I'm in town I go at least once to Fukumimi in addition to Monta to get my Ramen fix.

I have to admit up front that I am NOT a ramen connoisseur. I enjoy it, I eat it, I seek it out. But I am not the local ramen expert that I know some of my fellow Yelpers are. 

But I know soulful, textured, thoughtful food. And Fukumimi Ramen is serving that in droves. 

SERVICE: Like any restaurant, the experience starts with a greeting. The staff there is wonderful. They are warm, informative, helpful, and even on a busy night, they are willing to make yours a pleasurable experience.  There are not enough places in town that care about how their customers are treated. I like to give my business to those who do.

FOOD: I have never had anything like their broth. It's rich and complex. At my first bite, my taste buds were prepped for a thin, savory broth. But upon tasting what Fukimimi Ramen calls a broth, I had to stop and pause. I actually put my chopsticks and spoon down to reflect. When was the last time a taste of broth gave you pause? Since I had the Fukumimi Ramen I can only speak about its pleasures. Add the noodles, the green onion, the extra pork belly, and the egg to that rich broth and you have a dish to drive all the way to Eastern and Trop to try.  The Fukumimi and the karaage are spectacular.  The karaage is a salty, tender, perfectly fried piece of chicken.  But all of its crunchy pleasures could not take away from that ramen dish.  And three cheers for their portion sizes. It was a joy not to be swimming in ridiculous amounts of uneaten food after my meal.

THE REVELATION: The egg. I don't know if theirs is completely unique, but it was certainly unique to me. It is officially my favorite egg. I unsuccessfully tried to coax a secret out of the chef. All I know is this: I could eat that soy sauce flavored egg every day of my life. Every day. They are magic. I need to find out if there is a dish that is focused on eggs there. The eggs are that serious for me.

TIPS: They have a frequent visitor card that entitles you to a karaage (I believe) after a few visits. Also, they have  small space, so you might want to pop in at an off time to ensure you get the experience during a quiet time. They get some traffic in the evenings.  Don't let the neighborhood keep you away. It's in a working class area that is located next to a busy street (Trop)--no need to pull up and be concerned.  

They've been open for a little over a week, and I've been back three times. I know people are excited about getting the gyoza going, but there is so much to love there that foodies will never miss it.  

I plan to add this to my place to my regular rotation. Their location next to a Baskin and Robbins may become an issue this summer, but luckily I leave so satisfied that ice cream isn't even a consideration.  At least not on a chilly November night.

They deserve every one of those five stars. This place is outstanding.  Even if they never give me the secret of the egg.

This was my first foray into the world of Real ramen, as opposed to Cup O'Noodles poor-kid ramen. I was pleasantly surprised.

I guess normally ramen is made with pork, but Fukumimi had chicken ramen so I tried that. The broth was just right on a crisp winter night. The appetizer was juicy bits of fried chicken. Unfortunately the name escapes me.

Service was great and all the people seemed very friendly. It's one of those places where there's not just one thing that's great, but everything is done very well, and I can get behind a place like that.

Ate here a couple of times now. Both times, I ordered the Kogashi ramen. The broth is rich and flavorful and the noodles are great. We arrived with 10 people on a weeknight and they were able to accommodate us.  Of the 10, 7 were children. The prices for a rice bowl and chicken or curry for the kids make this place very affordable. Love, love, love this place. I can't wait to go back. The only pitfall is they are right next door to Baskin & Robbins and I haven't yet found a way to stay out of that store.
I visited Fukumimi Ramen in November during my trip to Las Vegas strip. I had their chicken flavored ramen. I really enjoy my meal.
Tonkotsu Ramen is my favorite and the Fukumimi ramen is the best...highly recommended! ??????
A very good find . Tiny place but the ramen is awesome . I ordered the spicy katsouramen  and it's divine and their kimchi tofu is also great . Will come back again . Very good service as well

It was 5 ish late Saturday afternoon, and the cold was really setting in.  A hearty bowl of ramen was definitely the right call.  Hubby ordered TanTan Men.  He scoffed it down, and raved about it.  I had the Fukumimi ramen.  Really liked it, but could have cared less for the 3 large sheets of nori.  It already had seaweed oil, but I suppose it is a personal preference.  The chashu was delicious.  The bean sprouts could be cooked less, I like mine just blanched... my only real complaint.  

Our table (by the entrance) was wobbly, and so was my chair.  Figured there was a slope on the concrete floor.  Hubby broke a ohashi to correct the wobbliness, so table now no longer wobbles, just on slight angle with the floor So if you happen to sit by the window table, and notice the slant, that's my hubby's 'workmanship':)   

Yuki, our server, presented us with a 'stamp' card... eat 4 bowls=choice of free karaage or gyoza.   Novel idea. Per Yuki's recommendation, we will definitely to try the karaage.  She claims that it's better than KFC.   Will definitely return.  Be warned though, restaurant is narrow, and with limited seating, like Monta.  At that time, all the tables were already filled... and they had a steady stream of patrons... mostly Japanese.  Good sign. :)

Found this place thru yelp. We were hungry after a long flight and yelped for a ramen place. This place was awesome, quaint, and lit. Ramen were super delicious. Staff were awesome. Ramen was on point. Prices were reasonable. Love the garlic chicken appetizer. This restaurant is small and gets full quickly so better come hungry and early. 
Would go back here over and over again.

Wait staff is very nice! Yummy tonkotsu broth and excellent melt in your mouth char siu!  Must order the karaage (Japanese fried chicken)!  Basically excellent ramen and what's even better you don't have to go to across town to Chinatown.

Came here during lunch on a Wednesday, and wow was it a treat. The restaurant itself isn't too large, it literally looks like a storefront imported directly from the heart of Tokyo, which made the ambiance a part of the experience. When a small place is crowded, that's how you know it's good. 

Me and my friend both ordered Ramen with a side dish, I got chicken ramen with kimchi on the side, he got porkbelly ramen with dumplings, they have specific names I just don't recall them haha. Anyways, the service was very quick for being so busy, we got all of our orders including the ramen in what must've been no longer than 5 minutes. 

The ramen came in this giant and traditional looking bowl, steaming at the top. First of all, the noodles were something else. They were the perfect consistency, not falling apart to the touch, but not hard enough to choke on. I could tell they were homemade, which is a big plus for me. The broth was bursting with flavor, and of course the chicken, egg and bean sprouts all made the meal feel authentic and delicious. The dumplings were perfectly seared on one side, and soft on the other with well seasoned meat inside. The kimchi was no push over either, spicy and zingy without being over powering.

And overall the prices were very good. I would definitely recommend this place, not even to anyone who likes ramen specifically, but to anyone who likes good food with fast service and a great ambiance.
I dig this place!  Great food, good service, and really yummy fresh noodles.  I love the fact that they nail the perfect soft-boiled egg on top; be sure to order an extra one for $1!

Came here because we wanted soup. And Fukumimi was one of the closer ramen shops still open. Glad we came because the tonkotsu salt ramen was good! The broth wasn't too thick either but it was still flavorful. I would def come back to try the other ones.

Parking: there's a lot
Price: $7-10 

And I def wanna try the honey garlic chicken too next time.

I dunno what it was exactly maybe the perfectly soft boiled egg and how it was marinated to the noodles (they were aldente and not over cooked).... but I apparently liked it so much that I finished it all up. See pictue

TERRIBLE SERVICE!!! The WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED! Server had some major attitude who slammed things and never bothered to check on us after messing up our order.

Basically they screwed up an order and refused to fix it. On top of that we got major attitude regardless of how nice we were to her initially. In addition, they took their time closing out our table while we waited so long just to pay. Talk about taking things too personally. It affected the next guests having to wait for a table. Never coming back here again. Especially because that one server with the rude attitude. 

Don't waste your time here.
I always get the tonkotsu ramen here. It's okay. The tonkotsu at Monta Ramen is richer and more delicious, though. The kaarage is amazing. Try it.

I visited Las Vegas for Japanese 7 Days Workshop.
It was good start with Japanese Ramen .

My first time here & I LOVED how delicious their ramen is. I had the Kara Miso ramen & my hubby had the Tori ramen. My ramen's flavor was just right - not too salty. Hubby said his was a bit salty, but to be fair, his was a salt based broth as listed on the menu. Cons - agedashi tofu appetizer came out after our soup. Also, it's a shame that they don't have more appetizer offerings.

Hands down the best ramen in vegas. 
We had gyoza, tan tan men and Shoyu Tonkatsu ramen. 

The gyoza had little crisps on one side of skins. The fillings were nice flavored.  

The Tonkatsu ramen noodles were cooked to perfection.  Just right not too soft. The soup was mild and not too salty like others. The chashu pork slices were soft and flavorful. The half egg was so delicious. 

This was my first time had Tan tan men. It was different.  I loved the thick noodles had more chewiness than the thin noodle.  The soup had nutty taste.  I wished they put more minced pork in there.

I was expecting a full flavored broth from the Tonkostu but it sucked. 

First we were seated immediately but it wasn't busy. We ordered and asked for two waters and only got one water. The tea is in a can not brewed. 

Second of all, I ordered the spicy Tonkostu but the broth tasted like chicken broth. If it was chicken broth, it had no flavor. The noodles were cold and my egg was cold. It was very disappointing. The meat was horribly sliced and tough. The whole meal sucked.  

I don't understand where the good reviews come from at all. The whole ramen bowl was a failure. The service sucked too. No one asked if the meal was good or not. I have been to a couple of Ramen spots and this one failed the most. Nothing was good about it. I wouldn't recommend anyone here there are Ramen spots with much more flavorful broths and better noodles out here in Vegas.

We found this place on yelp because it was right across the street from where we got a massage.  It was a cold day so Ramen sounded really good. They had great reviews on here so we gave it a shot, and it helped being so far off the strip where prices were a lot more affordable.  

We loved the Ramen! Two of us got the classic Ramen. I added some chili oil and chili flake to mine to spice it up a bit. I ate every last drop, it was amazing. We also had some edamame which was cooked to perfection.  If I ever happen to be in the Las Vegas area again, I would definitely come back. 

The waitress was nice and helpful. The cooks greeted us and said goodbye. It was a great atmosphere for all ages! Thank you for lunch!

Fukumimi WAS my favorite ramen place in town. But why the one star you may ask?

My friend and I would come to Fukumimi regularly and get the tonkotsu with thick noodles. But one day they got our order wrong and gave us thin noodles instead of thick. We were really craving for our thick-noodled meal, so we asked if it would be possible to get the right noodles. What happens next is we both get a haphazardly made soup; yes, it came with the thick noodles we requested, but the pork was crumbled and the toppings messily placed. We didn't think anything of it, but later that night and following day, we both had a bad case of diarrhea, stomach aches, and one of us even threw up a few times. 

We are sad to have had this experience because they made very tasty and flavorful ramen, but we think that it's more than just a coincidence that we both got sick after asking for them to correct our order. We had this for lunch, we didn't eat anything else that was the same prior, and we had eaten here at least 7 other times and didn't get sick before hand. Be wary when coming to this establishment.
Pretty good ramen, a little small serving.  I will visit again if I am in the area.  Staff are great.
Fukumimi Ramen is definitely one of my go to Ramen spots here in vegas. Its located in a not so crowded/busy area so it is very convenient. The ramen is very good and the service is awesome ! (:

Place is very small, tight and packed. 

I didn't like the soup i had, it tasted too much peanut / oil in it. But my friend's broth tasted good. Ground pork tasted good as well. Chicken Appetizer would be better if it has any dipping sauce in it

Server was prompt and nice. 

Would still come back and give it another chance

My favorite ramen place of Las Vegas! I'm come here at least once a week because it's really close to my work. Everything is always super good and I fill up the stamp card super fast and I get gyoza to go. I usually get karamiso or tantanmen
Great place to eat if you want good ramen. Food is delicious, and prices are much cheaper. Tried chicken Ramen, was delicious, curry rice was also great.

Great food. Great prices. Good service.

Long waits when it's busy (which is pretty much every mealtime). Hard benches with very uncomfortable backs!  Who let *that* happen?!

The Agedashi Tofu is sublime. Don't know how they do it, but the sauce is perfection. 

The noodle dishes are tasty and filling. Do not come expecting a big hunk of meat in your dish - it is just another tasty little thing, like the egg and the ... whatever the black vegetable is.

Haven't had anything that I didn't like. The bowl with the garlic sauce is particularly savory.

On a cold dessert day, our family decided to try this place out. Thanks to yelp we were able to find this local gem!! You can tell that this place is a popular joint based on the amount of people waiting outside. Luckily our family of 8 only had to wait 15-20 minutes to be seated during the lunch rush. 

We started our order with the gyoza and the karaage. The gyoza was crisp at the base and had a flavorful bite. The karaage was crunchy and airy I the outside. Wonderful start to our meal. 

Our family tried the various ramen. My personal favorite was the kogashi ramen (its the one with the extra garlic oil and fried garlic topping). But they are all very comforting and packed with flavor. The chashu was so tender it falls apart when you pick them up!

Overall a wonderful little gem, will def. be visiting here next time we are in the area.

My family tried out Sora yesterday and although the service was great we thought the ramen was just alright.  We tried Fukumimi today and loved the ramen! The chicken bowl was very good and my husband loved the spicy.  The karage was excellent. The tables were full when we arrived and a party of 5 was in front of us. We signed in and waited about 20 min. A group of 6 came in a couple of minutes after us.  One of the waitresses (not Asian) tried to seat the party of six before us.  Then she was a bit rude when told her we were next.   Our water glasses were empty and we had to flag someone down to get more.  Nobody checked on us to see if everything was alright or if we needed anything. The Asian waitress was nice and seemed to be trying hard to please customers but the other gal needs to work on her people skills.  If the service was better I'd give them a 5.

Eastern and Tropincan is a bit of an odd and dingy area, not the place you would expect to find more than good ramen house. It's tucked away between Baskin & Robbins and a tax place. Get the miso; so good. I'll be a monthly regular here, that is a promise.
Fukin Ramen The Best! Get some appetizers first. Service is awesome. They do need some music without commercials but you are not here that long.....so.... Shut up and eat!

Came here yesterday with 5 other friends. Place is very small and does not take reservations. Make sure your whole party is there because they won't seat you until then. 

Service is very good. Servers come over quickly and get your order in. Food came out in about 10-15 minutes and we all ate pretty quickly. You can tell waitresses hustle to turn the tables.

I ordered the gyoza and Karamiso ramen with thick noodles.

Karamiso ramen (5stars)- fragrant rich broth. I had them put the spicy paste on the side so I could stir in the spice to my liking. It comes with thick noodle but you can get thin if you prefer. I myself prefer the chewy thick noodles. 

Gyoza (5stars) - comes with 6 pieces and these are pan fried. I believe the meat inside the dumplings were pork. Anyways quite delicious. 

Tip make sure to get a stamp card. For every 4 bowls of ramen you buy you get a free appetizer of your choosing. These add up quick!

During the cold winter of Nevada, I like a nice bowl of ramen to keep warm, but driving all the way to Chinatown is such a hassle. When I heard of a new ramen place opening closer to Henderson, I had to try it. Sadly, though, it just didn't hit the spot.

I came here on a Sunday night and it wasn't too busy, I'd say half filled. There are probably around 20 or so seats, so not a terribly large place but it is cozy. They were quick to seat us, but they were a bit slow to take our order. We started with the Karaage then I ordered the Tan Tan Men and my boyfriend had their Tonkotsu Salt Ramen. The wait for the food wasn't too long, and we were sitting at the bar so it was fun watching them prepare the food.

Karaage - I thought this was the best part of the meal. It was lightly breaded and nicely fried without being too oily. The chicken was still moist and very flavorful. It came with some salt on the side in case you wanted that extra sodium. There was also a little side salad with a tasty dressing, my guess is ginger miso. 

Tan Tan Men - I was pretty disappointed with this. The initial bite was good, but as I continued to eat it, I liked it less and less. The broth was too creamy and thick, and when I'm at a ramen place, I love to drink the soup. But this is not a soup to just sip on with the noodles, it's more of a thin gravy. Also, the flavor just seemed off, similar that musty flavor of bamboo shoots? I just wasn't a fan of it.

Tonkotsu Salt Ramen - It comes with black garlic oil, but I think it could have used a little more. The broth was decent, it had a fairly well developed flavor. I just didn't like that it was so fatty. I know Tonkotsu has lots of pork fat in it, but this one just seemed to have a thick layer of oil on top of the soup. I could just feel it coating my intestines. Another thing is that they're a little stingy with the meat, there was only one piece of char siu. I will say that I liked the egg though. It was perfectly runny, but it was only room temperature at best. 

Overall, the ramen was decent, but I would not get the Tan Tan Men. I'm not jumping out of my seat to come here again, but if I really have to have my ramen fix and am not willing to drive out to Chinatown, this place will do.

Finally got to try some Ramen in the side of town that is known for it. This place does not look like much from outside, but the food was delicious. My portion was perfect. The pork belly was so good and the broth was awesome. Our waitress was very attentive and helpful in guiding us to a great choice from the menu. I will definitely recommend coming here and cannot wait to come back.
Food was delicious we had the spicy ramen and the chicken curry every was very good. Coming back soon!

Good, solid ramen. Craving something aside from Thanksgiving leftovers, I was able to find this spot on Yelp and the reviews seemed favorable. Giving me an excuse to check it out, I went down there last night. I had the Tantan Men and my girlfriend had the Miso Ramen. 

The Tantan Men was good: a decent blend of savory and spice. My only negative critique might be that the broth was actually almost a bit too rich. The pork broth thickened with chili oil and beef fat made a very sturdy base that I was not expecting. It was a good meal, but be prepared for something richer than other ramen varieties if you order it. 

As stated, my girlfriend had the Miso ramen, and she was very complimentary of the meal. She enjoyed the flavor of the broth and noodles, as well as the corn and soft-boiled egg. The pork was described as being very savory and tender, and she was very happy we got the chance to check this place out.

For those who enjoy Asian-style noodles and the flavor of ramen or just like finding new places to eat, I would highly recommend Fukumimi Ramen

I have been here twice, and both times I've been impressed.  I'm sitting at my desk, in a food coma and loving every second of it.  The staff is friendly, the food is great.  Other people say that the price is high, but so is the quality.  Apparently, in ramen, you get what you pay for, or at least you do here.

When i walked in, the place was packed for Friday lunch - i knew it was going to be good. I sat at the bar, and was served quickly. I amended my Tantan with an egg and some sprouts, and i couldn't be happier with the result. The portion is perfect. 
For ambiance and flavor, i would recommend this to anyone.
The food is okay. The ladies that work here have an attitude. Otherwise, the place is alright.
Love this place, small but cozy, the service is always good and the ramen on point. I'm a regular cause of this and is walking distance HELL YEAH!

I always love this place. 
I personally am very picky considering I work in food. Im always nitpicking service, cleanliness, and taste compared to price and serving size. To be honest I loved this place. The menu is kind of small but for a small shop it's perfect. I always get the classic ramen with spicy sauce. It has a nice kick to it without setting your mouth on fire. Just enough for a slight burn which is great when you're drinking half your meal. 
The portions are great in my opinion. Not much experience with ramen shops but their food is enough to fill me up completely. Prices are cheap. Flavor is wonderful. The meat in the ramen just falls apart which is great so you can break it up and have some meat in every bite! 
Service has always been kind and tends to our needs. I have never had to wait for them for long at all. Only complaint is they do not have dessert. But they are right next to Baskin Robbins so it's all good lol 
Also, you HAVE TO try the chicken karaage. It is so unbelievably addicting. And their salad is awesome too. I just love it here

Honey garlic chicken was more like salty tangy chicken.  First time to visit this joint was because of Yelp. Wasn't worth the drive. 
Service was so-so.
Had a party of 6, no table big enough for us to sit comfortably.

This is probably the best noodle shop In Las Vegas. Its always busy and always worth the wait.

The honey garlic appetizer is fantastic.

If you ever find yourself on the east side of the meadows and find yourself craving some of that wonderful ramen you find on the Asian strip, worry no more. A new ramen place just opened up on this side of town and I'm sure that is here to stay!
 FukUmimi.......don't know what that means, but all I know is that it translates into some fuk'n good ramen! and even though this place is on the other side of town away from the competition, it is sure to make all other ramen places sweat. I can't say that is the best but it is sure up there with the big Monta and Sora.
 I ordered the miso ramen. The broth was thick and packed with intense flavors, the noodles were soft and chewy, the slices of pork also soft as butter. It all was gone in a matter of minutes. Left me wondering if it had actually been real, but the empty bowl, the bill on the table and my hunger gone, confirmed it all. I had just had a bowl of awesomeness. 
 The place is small but very inviting, the simplicity of the design a very common Japanese characteristic gives it the feel of authenticity, as well as the majority of customers at that time. Koreans? Japanese? I don't know..all I know is that this Mexican was enjoying his noodles like everyone else in the building. For one brief  tasty moment in time, we were all speaking the same ramen language. slurp! slurp! slurp! 
There are also other items on the menu that I had never had before like tantanmen which is what I will try next time I visit, or karaage, or curry.... I can't wait to head east!

Monta.....Sora.....you know I love you.....But I'm going to FukUmimi!

My first search for Ramen in LV w/ a filter of one $ led me here. Wow. This was phenomenal and rather than me ask what the top customer choices were at their place, they had signs up everywhere with a Top 3 list of ramen ordered. I ended up having the extra garlic oil one (forgot the name, writing this review late) and an unsweetened green tea, PERFECTION. Definitely coming back, great food!

I have completed 4 stamp cards in this ramen bar, that just means i loved the place and the free Karaage. FUKUMIMI shouldnt i get a loyalty rewards? Just kidding,  This is one of my favourite Japanese Ramen Bar in Las Vegas.  Will definitely go just need one more stamp on my card HAHAHA!

This is the best ramen in Vegas, IMHO - better than Sora & Monta, and all of the other small ramen shops that dot the Vegas landscape.  The salt tonkotsu ramen is the best dish on the menu, and you can pay a couple of dollars more for the Fukumimi ramen (which is a meatier version with sheets of nori).  The chicken karage is just as delicious, and I honestly do not know how they are able to fry the chicken so delicately and keep it ultra-juicy.  Waitstaff is always awesome and pleasant.  

It's a fairly small restaurant and it can get packed pretty quickly, but the food is worth the wait.  Two bowls of ramen with a starter of karage for under $20 makes this meal the best value in the city!

Yay! I'm a fan!!!!!!!!!!

I actually host my first UYE (pre UNLV game) on 2/20/13 here and sooooo glad I did! 

We had a party of 9 or 10 and the service was fast and the young lady was super sweet!

I started off by ordering the table several orders of edamame and kimchi. 
The edamame was piping hot and salted.
I'm really glad I ordered both because for some reason this is my new fav kimchi! I must go back and buy a whole bunch! 

VEGETARIANS BEWARE! They do not have any veggie options. :) 
I'm not strict so I chose to get the Tori Ramen (chicken broth) with no egg and no chicken. WOW! It was really good! The broth was perfect not too oily and not too salty. I really liked the noodles how they were thin and a little firm. I ordered add seaweed to mine but I think she/they forgot to add it oh well :)
They are famous for their pork based broth but I strictly do not eat pork so that was totally out. 

All and all it was a super great spot and a super great UYE of sweet new Yelp friends. I def need to take hubby here before it starts turning very hot and non soup yummy weather :)

I'M NEED...I'M IN NEED of their KIMCHI!!!!!!!!!

New ramen place in town located on the NE corner of Tropicana and Eastern, next to the Baskin Robbins. Seem like a typical ramen-ya. 

Typical japanese greeting upon entrance, seated quickly. Came to the restaurant on a Wednesday evening around 530ish. There was maybe 2 other parties there aside from us. If my memory serves me correctly, this used to be a different japanese restaurant that was based on sushi before. 

The restaurant is a brightly lit restaurant with a row of bar seats facing the kitchen, and a row of tables with chairs on one side and a long extending wood bench on the opposite side. 

Service, the waitress was nice to get our waters. But seemed to like hover around waiting for us to order (which was a little weird). 

They had two soup broths (mainly pork [tonkotsu]) but they had a chicken [tori] option. The tonkotsu based ramen's consisted on a salt, soy, miso, spicy, and their special Fukumimi ramen. Each their own style. I believe they all use the same type of ramen noodles (thin straight noodles, very similar to the ones at Monta). Prices are fairly average ranging from $7.50 for the salt and soy tonkotsu, $8.20 for the miso or spicy option, or $9.50 for their special fukumimi ramen that i believe has extra meat. The chicken ramen is similar to the salt tonkotsu ramen except its a "creamy rich chicken soup base" and also had the garlic oil. There is options for extra toppings at additional cost. Didnt see an option for extra noodles though. They also had two other ramens, one was tantan men and the other was tomato ramen (cold). uhh if i remember correctly, tantan men is not a ramen, also in fact, its a dry noodle. Very interesting. 

My friend and I had ordered salt (me) and soy (her). Another party had seated next to us. Apparently the waitress got confused on the orders and asked our table what we had gotten and see if it matched the order she had (but found out was the other table). When the food had come, she went to their table and asked them before figuring out it was for our table. Uh.. Lol.. i thought she had that figured out? guess not.

Now for the food. Soup base was ok. Can't figure out if i like it or not. Initially when the ramen had came, i had tried both soup bases from mine and my friends. one salt base, one soy based.. One was saltier than the other but me and my friend had opposing opinions. Both our ramens had one slice of pork, 1/2 a soft boiled egg, some pickled ginger, onions, and bean sprouts.. The thing that was different was mine had this black garlic oil vs hers had a piece of nori. 

Honestly, i couldnt taste the "original fragrant garlic oil" it mentions. yah i see it but i dont think its as fragrant as it may seem to be. Another thing we had noticed was all the tables, except the bar, did not have any seasoning items. Not even the basic ones you see like chili pepper or chili oil.. or sesame seeds.. Was kind of surprised. 

The pork was more lean in comparison to what you get at Monta. Wished they had left the pickled ginger as a side u can put yourself instead of it being in the bowl already. 

The place isnt bad. Price is average. Good for students at UNLV. Nearby ramen place, dont have to drive to chinatown.
Great ramen. I live super close to here and I've gone five times in the last month. I love the service but the food is what keeps me going back.
Taste good.  Different than Monta.  Fukumimi has richer and more fusion taste compared to Monta.  Will be back again!

Have came here numerous times. Close to UNLV. Food is most often pretty good, however , recently something seems off. Fukumimi Ramen, karragge , edamame, and honey karragge are what we usually get. Also service used to be pretty good but now seems to have dwindled just a bit. Just the waitresses not the cooks, cooks are always friendly! Still waaaaaassay better than Monta.  Would be nice if they were closer to Summerlin.

The best Ramen and kimchi hands on!!! I don't go anywhere else for a craving. I always order their fukumimi Ramen with extra corn and egg, and my hubby always have spicy miso Ramen. For our appetizer kimchi kimchi kimchi! Oh also don't miss to try their sobodo bowl!
By far the best ramen I've  had.  I recommend the fukumimi and chicken karaage. Delicious! Must try!
Tasty ramen. I felt it was a little overpriced since i dont think any noodle soup is worth much more than $5 a bowl.  The interior is tiny and cozy and the staff are nice.

I gave this place 3 stars because the service was OK and the broth was a little salty to me. 

I tried the fukumimi chicken and like I said before, I like a lot of broth in my ramen (usually less noodles) and the upgrade to getting more soup is $4.00 TOTALLY OVERPRICED. When I go to other ramen places it's more like $1-1.50. 

When I asked for more broth, the server looked at me like I was crazy. (maybe since it's new, I was the first person to ask.. BUT STILL. Educate yourself on where you work. = my opinion) 

This is the closest decent ramen place near UNLV so I might be back... but only for that reason.
Cool little spot, if doing dinner be prepared to wait. It's a busy place. Service is decent, a bit tight seating. Portions aren't too big so if you're a beast like me, a side of steamed rice will do.
I have never had traditional ramen and now I will never go back to the cups. The location is small and intimate but welcoming. You can't go wrong with any of the ramen.

It's hard to find really good Ramen in Las Vegas, but this is the place. I've only had two of the dishes thus far, the chicken and beef. But so far so good. Nice when you don't want to venture into Chinatown.
Great noodles and great service.  Will definitely go back.  Our server was really nice and recommended the kimchi which was fabulous.
Definitely a must  try when in Vegas, the taste is pretty good most ramen places in Las Vegas have good taste they only differ in condiments and offerings for side dishes.
My all time FAVE love this place!!  I get it after work a lot and I must say its DELISH every time !! Tan tan men is my fave GREAT FLAVORS and awesome staff !!

This place is small and doesn't look like much but the food was seriously on point! One of the best ramen I've ever eaten. Price was a bonus. My family and I loved everything we ordered and plan to visit next time we're in Vegas. Oh and the staff was really friendly!
Awesome place to grab some ramen to go. I have never dined in, but the staff is always friendly and my food is packed nicely so I can take it back to work and enjoy.
Fukumimi ramen is great, been there 2 times and is always delicious. Great food and great service. The pork ramen is the best, but salt and soy are good to. Will definitely be back.

Loved this place. The chicken Karaage alone is worth going back for. Had a group of 8 & everyone loved it. Others raved over their Fukumimi Ramen.I had the chicken ramen which was good but not great. I can't wait to go back & try the Fukumimi ramen.

A friend recommended this ramen place. It was my first time. Got the tonkatsu salt ramen and karaage chicken. The pork in the ramen is really juicy and not dry. The chicken was amazing; juicy. It's a reasonable price and it tasted good. Will return next time.

I've seen many pictures of Fukumimi Ramen from my coworker's and heard good reviews about them. I was really craving ramen because I thought about Naruto ramen and was roaming around Yelp. It's on Eastern and Tropicana, when you walk in the interior was very small (smaller than Monta on Spring Mountain and Decatur).

SERVICE
We were greeted right away and arrived around 1:20pm. They were kind of busy but not packed/no line. It took around a few minutes to be seated and received drinks immediately. Waitress was nice and patient because my party was not sure which broth they wanted to get. But overall good service.

FOOD
I ordered the Kara-miso Ramen (Spicy Miso) with thick noodles. By its appearance, the broth looks spicy but it was not as spicy as I thought it would be. Compared to other ramen places in Las Vegas the broth is actually spicy, other places just put a ton of spicy powder to make it "spicy". The ramen I ordered came with pork belly chashu, seasoned eggs, green onion, and sprouts PLUS corn (Kara-miso came with corn, what a bonus and it's delicious).

CONCLUSION
I will be back to try different tonkotsu broths they offer, but I wish their portions were a little bit bigger (especially the rice bowls). Good food, good service.
We live in North Las Vegas and this is our go to ramen spot. It's small but the noodles out weigh the space. Fantastic service too.

This place is awesome! The broth is awesome. I usually don't eat all the broth but i did here. Ordered a side of the curry rice bowl and karaage. The curry is definitely comfort food. I added the karaage to the curry and mmmmmm. So good. Recommend this place for sure!

The kimchi is delicious...better than some korean joints I have tried. Honey garlic chicken was not sweet as I anticipated it to be..it tastes okay but I would not order it again. We also go the spicy miso fukumimi ramen. The broth was okay but the ramen was good. Overall, I would go back to try the another bowl.

I really, really want to give Fukumimi 5 stars.

They have one of the best ramen in Vegas. They have one of the best karaage. They have one of the best cold noodle.

What's lacking is the finishing touch in the noodles - namely, the softness of the noodle.

If you are crazy about ramen, you might know that there are more than six grades of softness / hardness of noodles when you order ramen in Japan: soft, regular, hard, barikata, harigane and konaotoshi.

It gets harder as you get to the end of the list - in Japanese, barikata means "very hard", "harigane" means steel wire, "konaotoshi" means "just drop the powder". As ridiculous as it sounds, those resolution in texture preference is for real in highly matured culture like Japanese cuisine. It's almost like the endless arms race of megapixels in digital cameras. And as you can clearly see, the grade is completely skewed toward hard noodles. Yes, it's true that hardcore ramen aficionados have the tendency to enjoy harder noodles.

But at Fukumimi, even ordering "very hard" specifically, brings disappointingly soft noodles.

I really hope they will address that particular issue, then I'll bump to five stars.
Honey Garlic Chicken could end a war if offered as a piece offering.  Seriously.. Don't pass on it.

Every time we come here it's awesome. Staff are so nice! I always order the gyoza and the spicy karamiso and it's delicious! My daughter gets chicken and rice and they're so nice about it bc she's 3. Definitely will keep coming back lol I already am on my second stamp card

Taking all the advice and trying the Tantan Men

It was Friday and it was cold. Ramen is what was needed!  Most fellow Yelpers gave glowing reviews, and Tetsuro's yelp really got my attention for tantan men.

I ordered ahead, adding an egg and green onion.  It was ready when I got there to pick it up, and it was packaged with consideration and regard knowing a little time & travel pass before consuming.  The broth and the other ingredients (spicy pork, bok choy, ramen noodles, egg, and green onion) were in two separate containers.

Back at the office, I combined the broth with the ingredients, stirred gently, and enjoyed the savoriness of this dish.  The broth is a juxtaposition of slight creaminess and a hint of spiciness as the spicy pork slowly & chili oil slowly become fused.  Like a good wine, it actually became better as I tasted, mixed, and tasted again.  A generous serving of green onion and perfectly cooked ramen noodles topped off a remarkable broth.  Looking forward to trying their spicy miso broth next time!
Im in Tucson at the moment and somehow wishing I was in Vegas instead and having ramen at fukumimi. Thats how good this place is  :)
Very good flavor! They were closed today for lunch and I waited till dinner to bring the family! Small place, long line is worth it!
I come here all the time on lunch break. This is my favorite Ramen spot. Get the TanTan Men and extra chashu

This is probably my favorite ramen join in the US. I love the fact that the base for everything is tonkotsu, and I love all the awesome variations on it. On my last visit this July in Vegas, I tried the spicy miso tonkotsu and it was hands down one of the best bowls of ramen I've ever had. Paired with their excellent appetizers and great service, this is a place that I visit every time that I go to Vegas, and I plan on visiting it again next year!
For real this place fed my soul! SO delicious! If you love ramen, well food in general you will love this place! Amazing

I really can't say that I am a fan. Crucify me all you want, but no ramen place in town has been able to touch Monta. I know they are different type of ramen broth, yada, yada, yada...but no ramen has left me craving for more like Monta has. 

This place is located on the corner of Trop and Eastern, in the Burlington Coat Factory parking lot, next to Baskin Robbins. I met Jaime W here right as they opened. The staff was very friendly and the restaurant clean and simple yet modern. I opted for the tonkotsu miso with extra side of chashu. Jaime went with their Tan tan ramen. My ramen was okay, the pieces of chashu were extremely fatty and falling apart. The broth was very salty without much flavor. I finished my bowl as I felt it was okay, not return worthy, but not gag worthy either. Jaime left practically entire bowl untouched. We also had a side of chicken kaarage of which I could not eat more than one small piece. The meat was just so fatty and poor quality while also drenched in grease.

The couple next to us with whom we struck up a conversation were not pleased with their food either, and left their bowls practically untouched. Maybe it was just a bad morning?  The prices were reasonable, the server friendly and when asked to split our check she didn't look at u like we just asked her to split an atom. 

Also, don't go bathing suit shopping after eating a bowl of ramen. Just a heads up.
Amazing food. We got the tofu, curry rice, spicy miso and garlic ramen. All delicious; better than any places in Texas or Cali I've been to. Def worth the plane ticket and hotel.

Late review--was here 1/30/17.

I absolutely love this place. Although it's a tiny restaurant, the atmosphere is nice, and the staff is very friendly.

The food is fairly portioned and very affordable. I forget which ones I tried but we had two kinds of ramen at our table and I tried both, as well as I split an order of curry with my husband, which was also great. (The curry's a quick cheap meal you can grab n' go. $3 small, $5 regular sized.) They do to-go orders by the way.

I'm so happy I have a closer favorite ramen place.

Service 5 stars 
Appetizer-Kimchi 5 stars 

TanTan Man- 2 stars
Not spicy at all, and the flavor was very bland. The meatball was too garlicky and sweet. Only two leaves of bok choi included. Quite disappointing. 

A little crowded, but nice place overall. I'll update my review if I decide to return and try a regular ramen noodle soup.

Jinya Ramen is still winning...hard to beat!
Classic Tomkotsu Ramen noodle taste. Reasonable price. Wait time 5 min. Small and cozy place.
So good! I like everything in here! I really like ramen, I tried other restaurants before, but FUKUMIMI is the best one!

Ramen..aka soul food Japanese style! After seeing it popup on the Yelp radar and reading some of the rave reviews from Tetsuro P. & Ursula U (who told me to get my butt over here)..Well I just had to see for myself.  I have to say this ramen house is on the path to being the cream of the crop! Now I know that 101 ways to make ramen doesn't qualify me as the noodle connoisseur, but compared to others noodle houses I've tried, hands down, Fukumimi rocks!  

Location: End corner of strip mall on Eastern/Tropicana ..plenty of parking spaces. A big plus for those of us whose home base is here in Henderson.  
 
Service/Atmosphere - A - The restaurant staff enthusiastically greeted us in Japanese as we stepped inside.  It was almost a full house when we arrived during the dinner hour, but we were seated right away. The hostess also did double duty as our server.  Friendly and pretty efficient considering how busy the place was. The small dining area was simple interior, single seating at the high top top counter facing the kitchen and tables of two lined back against the wall set close together.
