So close that nosy me got to see and question the party next to me on what dish she ordered that looked so good, which was the Fukumimi ramen.
 
Food:  A+  - Prices: fair most under $10

We ordered the Fukumimi Ramen, Karaage & Curry/rice bowl. 

Both Karaage & Curry bowl were very good, for the low price hard not to pass up either.

The Fukumimi - THE BEST!! This order is pretty large portion. The bowl width is average size, but deep in depth. It looked like a gourmet bowl of ramen, a pretty visual presentation. Seaweed lined half of the bowl filled with hot and steamy broth.  The tonkotsu (pork) broth ; perfect! It was packed with flavor, had a brown milky color, rich and creamy.  The thin noodles were delish and cooked to the right texture. Toppings: slices pork belly, tender, 1/2 of soft boiled egg, sprouts added some crunch and the scallions boosted the flavor even more. I want to say it's garlic infused oil, black in color that was drizzled on top as well.  This was such a delicious hearty meal.

This place is most definatley yummy for your tummy!

Thank you very much for their loyalty program which we can earn free Karaage or Gyoza after the five ramens.  I love their Karaage.  Karaage comes with small salad that is really good with the thick taste of noodle soup and Karaage itself too.  I used to try Salt and Miso, but I find soy is the best! Peak time is so crowded, so I try to avoid the peak time of meals.

I just need Ramen in my life, so just want for the Classic Ramen with chicken both, side salad and good old delicious Gyoza, and wash it down with Classic Coke!!! Always a seat and not to busy either, perfect spot to grab a bit and go!! Plus the noodles soft and chew, perfect!!
I was not impressed by there ramen. There wasn't much flavor, I was sad because I love ramen!

Fukumimi's broth is one of my faves here in Vegas! It's so rich and hearty--it's seriously the perfect dish for any hang over or sweater weather days lol. 

My absolute favorite thing about Fukumimi is their stamp card program. Every time you purchase 4 ramens, you get a FREE appetizer your next visit. (Anything free is honestly worth Yelp-ing about.) \_(?)_/ 

I also love their kimchi for their ramen. It's so tasty, it really does completes my ramen. I always get the Spicy Miso Ramen with kimchi and corn, but if it's your first time here, you can never go wrong with the Fukumimi Ramen. 

This establishment is very small, so its not too great for parties with 5 or more people (you'll seriously be waiting A WHILE.) Good tip though: make sure everybody in your party is present or they will NOT seat you. \_(?)_/

Had a party of 12 at 1:30pm on a Friday and they quickly accommodated us in their tight space. Had the agedashi tofu and chicken kaarage appetizers and tonkatsu miso ramen. So good! Took a star off because one meal was forgotten and brought after most of us were almost done. But overall, taste was good!
Wanted to try ramen and found this place and very delicious ramen. We tried the tantam men and it's good a little to peanut taste for me but will definitely go back to try out more dishes.

Drove across town to try a new ramen house. After reading all the stellar reviews I was not impressed. Ordered the Miso ramen, no flavor or depth, did not like the smell. The karaage and gyoza were very bland. Not worth driving back. I've had much better ramen - Sora/Monta. Good fast service.

Yup! The reviews here are LEGIT!  Forget Monta, Fukumimi is now my 'go to' place if I ever want ramen off the strip!

The chaysu here is one of the best I've had!  It's has plenty of meat and more meat than fat... mmm YUM!  .. and it was perfectly cut too!  Not too think, and not too thin.

The broth is good too, but I've had better.  It just wasn't as rich as I hoped it would be.  The noodles were GOOD and the egg was soft-boiled just the way it should be.  The karaage is breaded and fried just right, I LOVED it!

.. and they say you eat with your eyes first right?  Well, I have to say the ramen here is definitely one of the prettiest I've seen yet!  

FYI - the fukumimi ramen is the same as their tonkotsu but has more pieces of chaysu and seaweed. .. and get a punch card!

Great Noodles!! I wanted something spicy for my cold and they had the best noodles and I was able to get the spicy paste on the side and add it to my liking. Very friendly staff and fast courteous service
Yum. Thin ramen classic with pork chashu so good. I'm stuffed because I couldn't pass up the 6 pcs of Karage appetizer. With a Coke tab came to $16 before tip.

I decided to try a new place the other day and I happened to stumble across this restaurant. They dont have much on their menu, maybe because they're just starting up or maybe that's just the way they like it. 

Price.. decent. 

Service... was good. They always came around our table to ask if everything was okay or if we needed anything.

Food.. I had one of their ramens.. it was a bit too salty for me so I didnt end up finishing it. Honestly, I've had better for around the same price but with a bigger bowl, meaning more food. 



All in all, the experience was okay. But It's definitely not a restaurant that I would ever go back to. There's really nothing special there that makes my mouth water .. and there really isnt a dish that they serve that other japanese restaurants dont already serve (especially when other restaurants serve in bigger portions, better quality, etc)...

delicious ramen, maybe the best in vegas. rich broth and above average noodles. curry rice is good, too. 

place is small, so be prepared to wait if you go during between 6 and 8 pm-ish.

Finally a Ramen place on the east side!! I'm really excited since this place is so close to where I live!

Ok before anything else I just want to say that there is an old lady server that works here, and I think she hates me. I've been here twice and was treated with the same discourteous attitude. I tipped her $5 each time in hopes of a smile but to no avail...

Now that I got that off my chest it's down to business.

Fukumimi is known for their Tan Tan Men, (a spicy, very rich ramen) and their flaky karaage (fried battered chicken tenders that is a perfect match to your warm bowl of ramen). 

Lets start of with the noodles. Just like Monta Ramen House, they serve their ramen with firm noodles, I personally prefer Sapporo style noodles since it's more chewy, but there's nothing wrong with Fukumimi's straighter and firmer noodles.

The base of the Tan Tan men is hot and tasty. I had no problem slurping down their savory and slightly spicy ramen until I reached 3/4 of the bowl, at that point I was overwhelmed by its richness. Now I'm the kind of person who gets the XL bowls and order side dishes all over the table, yes that's me, but on this occasion, it was just a bowl of ramen and a side of karaage, but with just that I was already feeling heavy.

It's a well known fact that you can't have a bowl of hot ramen (in america) without chasu pork (those thinly sliced marinated braised pork bellies that melts in your mouth as you sip your steaming bowl of ramen).  Also adding a Tamago  (24 hour marinated hard boiled egg) with every ramen bowl wouldn't hurt.

Summary:

Noodles: Firm noodles
Ramen Base (Tan Tan Men):  Mild, Tasty, and Heavy
Chasu pork: Thicker cut than usual, and not melt -in-your-mouth like Monta's
Karaage: Chicken is tender, and Batter is nice and flaky. 
Soboro Bowl: Bland, and not satisfying
Service: Just Ok

Had the Tonkatsu miso ramen with egg, corn, bok choy, sprouts, and baked gyoza. Noodles were too thick. Not as flavorful as I would have liked. No mushrooms available which was disappointing. Gyoza was good. Wouldn't return. Other better ramen houses in Vegas.

We live in Aliante in North LV, and when we want ramen, we make the drive to Fukumimi. We have tried several ramen places in the city and this is our number one. We get the spicy tonkatsu with extra chashu. They are fast and the ramen broth is fully flavored. The spicy is about a medium but we get it more for the flavor. We also get the gyoza and honey garlic chicken. Both are good. Service is always great, and don't forget to ask for a ramen card! Every fourth ramen gets you a free app!

Affordable authentic and delicious. Been here many times and the ramen is always delicious! Service is fast the place is clean. And they have a great selection of Japanese dishes for folks that are not so into ramen.

Omg! For sure one of my faves the ramen is awesome and so was the curry and the gyoza! Highly recommended! However it's a small little hole in wall so you may have to wait but thats the best kind usually...

The food here is fantastic, my group ordered ramen dishes and compared to Monta it's more flavorful and less salty. My one real issue is the slightly awkward papers saying the restaurant is #1 plastered 5 times on the wall along with messy looking menu. Service was good, asked us for water and smiled. Overall it was a good experience.

I have never seen any service that could be worse than Fukumimi. It is the old ulgy bitchy female server that just make me sick and will never come back again! At first  she basicaly just ask what do you want , threw the chopstick to our table and and the end, she stood by our table staring at us act like cant wait to get the check book and see how much you guys tipped! 
Food is pretty good, noodle was not as good as Monta Ramen tho.

We ordered the Spicy Tonkatsu Ramen, Fukumimi Ramen, Creamy Chicken Ramen, and Soy Tonkatsu Ramen.

The first thing we noticed were the thick layers of oil on all four bowls of noodles.  We asked for a bowl and skimmed the oil as much as we could.

The spicy broth was very delicious.  The other three had similar shoyu taste.  The spicy ramen noodle was thicker than the other ones. They serve different types of ramen. The chashu meat was super tender and delicious. The eggs were very very tasty too.  We also liked the big pieces of seaweed.

The place is small but nice.  Service was great too.  Menu is simple. There aren't too many selections but we like that. Price is decent.  Serving portion is on the smaller side.

Overall, its a good ramen place but the soup was oily.

The food is so good here!  Your cooks are amazing!  Your servers are very rude though!  I come here all of the time and today my boyfriend even sarcastically said as we walked out the front door, "You ready for some bad service?"  I told him we don't always get crappy service but today was humorously bad.  The lovely server dropped my chopstix on the floor on accident, picked them up and placed them on the table for me to use again.  Five second rule guys.  She never smiled and had bad attitude with us the whole time but I don't care!  I will return for your bomb ass ramen but leave you lousy tips.  Except for that young Japanese server.  She smiles sometimes.

I fell in love with ramen when I lived in the Bay area last year, and so far of our slim pickings, Sora is the place I prefer. I found myself on the other side of town, and finally managed to fit in a trip to Fukumini, which is the third most-often-recommended place for ramen in Vegas (the second being Monta).

Despite the strip mall exterior, inside was small and cozy with bench seating and bar seating. I dined solo and was helped immediately. Staff was attentive. There is signage up advertising their limited-time summer special of cold noodles, as well as a new flavor of chicken: honey garlic, which sounded amazing but I was dining alone.

Ordered the tan tan men, for change of pace. Received a gigantic bowl of broth, bok choy, noodles, and sausage- the sausage was actually reminiscent of chorizo, full of fat and flavor and that distinctive orange tinge to the broth. The broth itself was super rich, and seems like it may have contained dairy. Noodles were chewy and thick, the way I like them. My only adjustment to this order in the future would be to add more bok choy- the three leaves in my dish simply were not enough to balance out the richness and fat in the sausage and broth.
Overall flavor profile was complex, with spice from the sausage, and again, very rich.

Later, this richness caused some stomach problems for me- consider yourself warned.
It's a tasty dish, with friendly service, but I'll probably stick with one of their more regular ramen dishes next- and try that chicken.

While getting my phone screen replaced, we were looking for somewhere to eat. Everything sounded good so we just decided to go to fukumimi. BEST DECISION OF THE VEGAS TRIP! This place was so good and reasonably priced. For four people, we ordered the honey garlic chicken, 2 orders of soboro rice (1 was to go cause it was that good), curry rice, miso ramen, and tan tan men ramen. We were all stuffed and the total including a 15% tip was about 45-50 if I'm not mistaken. Will definitely be back.

I like that they give you the option to order either thin or thick noodles. I had the tonkotsu spicy which was delicious. My fiance is picky with ramen and he was actually happy with this place. He had the tonkotsu salty and he was satisfied.
The absolute best Ramen place in town! I love the Ramen with the extra pork belly and the garlic one. Service is always friendly and quick. All appetizers are super tasty.

Had a really great dinner service was good appetizers for very flavorful salad was wonderful dressing was extremely tasty our soup was so rich and decadent full of marvelous flavors hit the spot on this cold evening definitely highly recommend this place simple menu great prices upbeat atmosphere check it out if you get a chance

I love this little hidden gem!!! Seriously, unless someone told me I have to try this spot I wouldn't even go over in that area. Luckily for me it's close to my work & my co-workers addicted to it too. The spicy miso is to die for. I crave it! Perfect amount of spice & heat. Their broth is thicker than manta but the flavor is stronger here. I personally prefer fukumimi to manta bc of the spicy & heat level of the broth & the different thickness of noodles offered. Fukumimi also has more appetizer & side options. The agedashi tofu & honey chicken is awesome. They also have a rewards card. For every 5 ramens you get a free app.

Shortly after landing in Las Vegas, our bellies were rumbling with curiosity to see what the city had to offer. We looked on yelp for nearby restaurants and chose Fukumimi because the answer to ramen is always yes.

Walked in to see a small, intimate restaurant with a couple of tables. We ate during off-peak hour but I can imagine it gets crowded quickly. My 3 friends and I were seated right away and started with chicken karaage and agedashi tofu as appetizers. Both were really good! The chicken was super juicy and crisp. Although we couldn't tell if it was the red light from the store sign reflecting off the meat or if it was slightly undercooked- we just ate it because it was tasty. 

I ordered the Tan Tan, which did not fulfill my ramen craving. It was a little too creamy for me, with a peanut aftertaste. I normally love all noodles+broth, but this broth didn't hit the spot. My boyfriend really liked it though so we ended up switching our bowls. He ordered the Fukumimi which in my opinion was a lot better. The broth was lighter and I enjoyed it more. 

Parking here is no issue because the restaurant is inside a huge mall complex. Staff is attentive and service is good. Overall, our party agreed it is more 3 stars than 4 stars on yelp. We got the top 3 popular ramen off the menu and they were all okay.

This place was way better than I expected. My expectations?  Just better than average, being so close to the University. Actually, this place is on par with several of the ramen spots that I frequent in DTLA (Little Tokyo).
Service was excellent as well.

Solid little joint!  Not a whole lot to the menu but they don't need it.  Their items are pretty tasty.  We ordered tan tan men, curry rice and chicken karaage.  All of the items were delicious and cheap!  Best of the all, the noodles were the right consistency.  mmmm LOVE ramen places.   Next time I'll try their shoiyu broth with Chasyu.

Love this place.. Everyone is very nice. I love the curry here, and my Mother loves the ramen. I will gladly drive from Downtown to eat here. After lunch, you can run to Walgreens just across the way.  How can you not like a place called Fukumimi?! Lol!

Food was good,  saboro bowl and Japanese fried chicken. Teeny bit overpriced...but the food definitely lived up to the 4 stars, solid 4 from me one less star for no lunch special and for chicken not having dipping options other than this awesome (but easily overdone) salt (msg?) lol. Lower prices or lunch special, more options for chicken dipping and you will get 5 all day

This restaurant has a focused menu - ramen and rice bowls - and everything is delicious! There are also a few appetizers and the kimchi tofu app is absolutely heavenly. The soft tofu melts in your mouth and kimchi  spice offers a perfect counterbalance. Prices are right and the staff are always friendly!
It's not the best ramen I've had, but it's pretty damn good! It's cheap, fast, and the employees are very sweet! Would recommend to anyone!
Whenever I'm on this side of town craving ramen I'll come here. I love the miso Tonkotsu ramen and Karaage. Staff and cooks are friendly.

I love the rich pork bases spicy with thin Ramen excluding the egg add two pieces of seaweed extra spice extra noodles every time I go it's always the same great taste this is officially one of my favorite Ramen places in Las Vegas fast good customer service and food

If you are in the East Side of town, you gotta stop by and check this place out! I cannot express the value of this place enough, as the spice freak that I am this place has great ramen, and it's not so far from the strip. It's my second time attending and the best thing is I always look forward to coming back, so much courtesy and attentiveness is attractive. I want everyone to come in and try it, because typing it down is not enough and it won't cut it. I adore fukumimi ramen
Really awesome tasting ramen. The only complaint I have is the price. It seems a little high, but I could be wrong. Still, great eats.

I tried their Tan Tan Men for the first time ever, but the broth was really rich and definitely one of my favorites. I always stopped by here whenever I go to Vegas, one of good things here is also that they open all day from lunch thru dinner. Most of restaurant in Vegas (especially in Casinos) they have break between lunch and dinner.  Their fried chicken is pretty good, and you can get one free fried chicken if you collect 4 stamps for each Ramen ordered. Is highly recommended Ramen place in Vegas.
Tried the "kogashi" it was true to it's description it was very fragrant full, spice level very tame, I tried other broths such as the "Fukumimi" but this is my go to.

Great place! I ordered the spicy ramen and usually other places say it's spicy and in reality its not at all! But this one without a doubt was SPICY and it was delicious!! The noodle was think, the spiciness was on point, the customer service was great, and the place is clean!!! I ordered it to go and they were pretty quick on giving me my order. Highly recommend trying it out! :)
Easily one of the best Ramen place in Vegas! Ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen with Miso, and I was not disappointed. With the affordable price, the taste is excellent.

I ordered Tonkatsu Salt Ramen here and it was sooo creamy. It was salty, spicy and a little sweet. Just like how i like my ramen. The place is busy when we got there around 8pm so if you're in a hurry, i wouldnt suggest coming here. But the wait for the food was quick. The server was very good too. I ordered a bunch of extras for my ramen and she didnt miss any of it. This is actually one of the best ramen that i have tried considering ive had authentic ramen from japan. So, its a must try!

6/7: I've been here several times. The waitresses are always friendly and beautiful here. Top notch service while enjoying a delicious meal! I'm not a big fan of Ramen noodles, so I usually get some sort of appetizer and rice bowl when I visit various Ramen shops. 

I always get the Karaage (Japanese fried chicken) here! So fresh, soft, and juicy. Delicious! One of the best food items I've ever had. I love saying Karaage too...such a cool word; I might name my next pet Karaage. 

TIP: I don't know if it's regular or seasoned salt that's included, but adding it to the Karaage makes it taste that much better!

Their regular size Chicken Bowl is great as well. I'm a returning customer!

Stopped by at the suggestion of a ramen-loving, foodie friend. Fukumimi does not disappoint! I had the Tonkatsu Ramen (Miso) with seaweed. The broth was rich in flavor, but not heavy and in my opinion not as salty as Monta's Miso Ramen. I ate every last bite.  

The dude ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen (Spicy) and an order of Karaage Chicken. His broth was also full of flavor, but not overwhelming, and the spice level was just right. Didn't try the Karaage, but the crisp looked great and it smelled wonderful...And that's coming from someone who doesn't generally the smell of chicken. 

The atmosphere was busy, but not too loud even with every table taken. Our server was friendly, polite and pretty attentive considering how busy it was. The place is small, but clean. 

We'll be back!

First time here and i absolutely love it! Came early for dinner so it wasn't that busy and no wait.. i had the fukumimi ramen and it was amazing! Good service too.. my new fave ramen place! But the waitress forgot go give me my stamp card and we ordered 4 ramens so we get free appetizer on our next visit.. boo! Hopefully when me and my friends comes back they won't forget again..

Second favorite ramen place in Vegas.

I always order the Fukumimi ramen and have yet to be disappointed. I have tried other ramen items off the menu, but the Fukumimi is the best. Broth is comparable to Jinya's Tonkatsu Black. And I love the thin noodles. I would have to say that I much rather prefer the pork in Fukumimi's versus Jinya's.

I usually order some gyoza and edamame here which come out hot and fresh. Doesn't "wow" you, but good appetizers nonetheless. 

This place can get very packed and seating gets kinda elbowy when there's a lot of people here. Wait times aren't usually an issue unless this place is already almost full.

A hole-in-a-wall restaurant that would satisfy you're ramen soup cravings. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen miso, it was very good. Without adding extra toppings, it was enough to fill me up. Also I tried the karage (Japanese fried chicken), it was crunchy and tasted like a large popcorn chicken. The menu items are inexpensive and affordable. The place is small and it gets crowded during the dinner rush. I would go back here and dine again when visiting Vegas.

I yelped from LAS airport and happened to find Fukumimi Ramen.  I usually go to restaurants around Decatur Blvd in the west part of Las Vegas, so I was not aware of this restaurant.   I ordered a regular tonkotsu Ramen and it was indeed a right choice.  Noodles were al dente and the tonkotsu soup broth was really authentic.  It was so delicious that I can't wait to come back again.  Also, I recommend their gyoza as well.  Don't forget to order one!
Their broth is pretty good, just tell them you don't want it too salty, good service I'll come back

My favorite ramen-ya; no offense to the others in town or to any other fans. This visit had me trying Kara Miso Ramen, a slightly thicker noodle, spicy (just right for me), corn, melt in your mouth pork belly, and my extra egg. Brought a 'first time to ramen' friend and M had the Fukumimi Ramen; tonkatsu based, thin noodle, garlic oil, nori, egg, pork belly. The house ramen is my most favorite but sometimes a girl has to switch it up.

Long wait, horrible portions and the noodles were undercooked. Always every time I've been here at least three times, the noodles had not been cooked properly. Not only the wait to be sat down was long but as well as the food. How hard is it to make ramen that barely has any portions and other ingredients in it besides the noodles, egg, and broth? I recommend monzo. I won't come back here ever again. The server can do something else with her nasty attitude.

It was so cold and we craved for some type of soup.  As my roommate has promoted to me, we decided to take a quick drive over.  I had their tonkotsu spicy and I requested the broth to be extra hot.  It came out so nice.  With a cold coming, my throat felt so good.  Their noodles were excellent and it was crunchy to me.  The sliced pork was very well portion and tender.  Soup was not too spicy.  Since my gf was afraid of spice, she went with the tonkotsu soy.  Judging by the fact that the bowl was empty.  It must have been solid for her. 

Service was above and beyond.  Because of my request for extra hot broth, they were a little confused.  They made an effort to have another person ask me what I asked to clear up the haze.  After we got out bill, we received a stamp card.  Buy 4 bowls and get one app free.  Winner! I do see us coming back again on a cold day.  

Place does get really packed.  We came in about 30 mins after opening and after it was full house.  There is bar seating and only about 5-6 tables.  Groups diners, you have been warned.
The food was excellent. The menu is small as its mostly ramen, but the food ia outstanding, full of flavor. Definaltely worth the teip off the strip.

Awesome ramen. The broth and pork both have so much flavor. The slightly aldente thick noodles are a great touch as well. The only reason I didn't give a full 5 is because the egg wasn't very good and that's always my favorite part. Maybe it was just a bit overcooked. I will definitely be going back though.

The Skinny: props for using proper Tonkotsu ramen noodles however the flavour of the broth just ain't up the snuff. Their karaage on the other hand is a good portion size and pretty tasty (3) Service: they messed up our order but it turned out okay because we were too full anyway (2) overall: the tonkotsu ramen broth is still subpar but at least decent, toppings are okay and reasonably priced. Wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if I was in the neighbourhood and having pregnancy-like cravings for ramen, I'd give this place another shot.(3)

Found out about this place and headed over for nice big bowl of Japanese lovin'.

We ordered a tonkotsu miso ramen ($8.20), fukumimi ramen($9.50), karaage ($3.90) and a curry bowl ($3.90). 

Here is my analysis of the ramen:

The Broth: meh - not enough porky fatty goodness in the broth - on the oink scale, this would rank about a 6/10 scale - detectable but definitely not enough.

The Noodles - kudos for the actual legit tonkotsu noodles (the straight, white noodles). Mildly overdone (I prefer a little more firmness) but definitely gets some marks for this.

Miscellaneous: Chashu - it's okay - not your melt-in-your mouth goodness but decent enough. Egg - good amount of runniness - perfectly cooked. Toppings amount - decent amount given the price.

The karaage was pretty good - nice crispness without too much coating and well seasoned. Very good portion size for the price too. Overall, I think I enjoyed the karaage better than the ramen actually.

We never received our curry bowl (the server forgot to put the order in) but that was okay because we were fairly stuffed after finishing our ramen and karaage. 

To me, what differentiates the true great from a decent ramen place is the broth -- and Fukumimi Ramen definitely wasn't "lickin' the bowl clean" kinda good for me. It lacked the soulful perfection from a great ramen joint. That being said, it's okay enough to fill the belly and the karaage was pretty good. For that, it gets a 3 starred review.

I'm not gonna write a super long review critiquing the details. 

1. It is closer to UNLV than the other two ramen houses with reasonable price and you get the same quality from sora and monta. 

2. This is like a combination of the good stuff from both sora and monta, they have garlic oil as their special spice (sora doesn't have garlic, monta doesn't have thinner miso soup)

3. For people who live near Henderson or the southeast, it is definitely a go to place for them. 

4. I think services are just the same as monta or sora or any other places. it all depends on the mood of the waitresses that day. 

Personally, if I'm in the mood for ramen, Both sora or monta doesn't really give me the "I HAVE TO go to that place" urge, I can go to all three.
Spicy Miso is pretty solid.  I usually get a side of curry to share.  Probably the best curry I've had.

OUTSTANDING.  Nothing else to say. 

Yelp wants me to.  Get RAMEN.  Dumplings, salad and fried chicken...nothing was bad.

The food came out in a very timely manner, and that was the particularly good thing.  I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen, and it was fine.  It was neither amazing nor horrible.  The noodles were served as I asked them to be (extra hard), and the soup was okay.  Overall, I had a very mediocre experience.

Dropped by on a Wednesday evening for dinner. They've long since become quite popular, so there was a bit of a wait. But it wasn't too bad.

Just like all of my prior experiences at Fukumimi the service is quick and friendly. The food selection is still good and it comes fairly quickly.

The food quality has remained consistently delicious. I even completely drank all of the soup from my Tonkotsu Soy ramen on this visit. Delicious!

So if you like ramen, this place is STILL a very good choice. You should have a very delicious and nice ramen dining experience.

Was a little iffy about the place at first (soups aren't really my thing especially ramen). But was really surprised by how amazing it tasted (not your ordinary ramen noodles you live off in college and while sick that I remember). 

Nothing really special about the place's look. Just a little hole in a place next to Walgreens, but well priced and worth a try. 

Highly recommend the honey garlic chicken appetizer....amazing. Craving it again as I speak.

In the race to monopolize on the booming ramen fad in Vegas, Fukumimi has created a splash in the ramen-ya scene. 

The quick and dirty: get the Fukumimi Ramen (shio-based). Your taste buds will thank you. 

The long and delectably disgustingly delicious: 
My friend's first reaction to seeing the The Fukumimi Ramen: "Wtf is that black stuff floating in there?!"
My response: "It's black garlic oil, noob!" 
So if any of you guys are hesitant about the layer of questionable black oily liquid floating in your broth, know that it's good for your tummy, your heart, and your soul.

But seriously, I loved the black garlic oil that they put in the broth- only adds more depth to this deceptively simple-tasting broth. It's not as hearty as some tonkotsu broths I've tried in the past, but it still packs a punch taste-wise. Best part of this broth is that it's not overly salty like some other ramen places...*cough* Monta *cough*

The only noodles available here are the thinner egg style noodles that regularly come with tonkotsu ramen. Even though I prefer thick noodles (Ramen Sora!!) the noodles here were perfectly al dente, not soggy at all.

The egg is always perfectly done with the yolk still half runny. Chashu is a bit well done compared to what I prefer. I love when that delicious pork belly melts in your mouth!

Soboro bowl: seasoned minced meat, egg, rice, and green onions. Very simple dish. I felt like this dish was just okay, not really memorable or something I would crave. I'd have liked a bit more of sauce/juice/gravy from the minced meat so it wouldn't be so dry.

Karaage: deep fried chicken. While very juicy and fresh, I felt it was a bit under-seasoned. 

If you intend to come here regularly, make sure you get a stamp card from your server. For every four bowls of ramen, you get a free appetizer: gyoza or karaage.

Overall, great service and a clean restaurant. I'll definitely be coming back for more ramen and to try their other bowls.

So another Japanese Ramen-Ya has graced this city and this time, it ain't in Chinatown! (in mini-mall Tokyo)  No this one is on East side by UNLV, where most of the students hang out. In any case, it just opened and once in a while, it's good to break away from the usual haunts (I still love you the best, Monta, but I wanna see what the others have to offer). Monogamy has no place in the F&B world when it comes to this glutton.

Fukumimi means 'Lucky Ear', and when I arrived at an off peak time period, the place was crawling with Japanese people (first good sign).  And the interior had a cheery and warm environment (aka, it actually looked like someone put some thought into it's design...I appreciate that)....good sign #2

I love it when the weather gets cold here, it's the perfect time for a piping hot bowl full of Ramen.  And on a particularly cold day like Saturday, I was running from my car to get into the steam filled restaurant to warm up!

Inside, it's a bright atmosphere with that new restaurant feel (kinda like a new car...didn't want to use the smell reference...)  I was seated at the counter, where I could see all the action.  The owner was working the line, (the Ramen component) while another gentleman worked the fryer, both working furiously to dish out orders.

I parked my seat down a bar stool, hoping to get warm when I realized it was much colder at the counter; they had air vents blowing cold air to counteract all the steam emanating from the open kitchen (I was freezing by the time I left...must remember that I can eat here in the Summer...and not sit at the counter!!!)

So Fukumimi's specialty is Tonkotsu Ramen, a pork bone broth that make the broth thick with a milky consistency that is very filling.  It's accompanied with slices of Pork Belly, Boiled Egg, Bean Sprouts, Corn and Scallions...and Noodles of course....

There are other things on the menu, Chicken Ramen, a cold Tomato Ramen and Tan Tan Men (a spicy Sichuan dish);  as well, there are various Rice Bowls that looked pretty good too.

On the Appetizer list: the Chicken Karage was recommended,  (and at $3.99 for six pieces, it's a bargain) and it came out piping hot.  I loved the crispness of fried skin, followed by a moist bite of juicy chicken flesh that sears the roof of your mouth, as steam billows through the tears-heaven...  Thoroughly enjoyable and worth coming for-a must get item!

And when the boiling, hot cauldron of noodle soup arrived in front of my icicle hanging nose,    I enveloped my face into it's hot breath, inhaling the fatty oils feeding my fifth sense.  I ordered the Miso Tonkotsu, a blend I find most palatable.

My first visual: long, thick slices of Pork Belly cut in the most unusual way to which, I have not seen before in Ramen (not that I'm complaining, I ordered extra Chasu Pork and I practically got the whole bowl full of it - score!!!)

As for the Broth, (the most important component of Ramen in my humble opinion) it was smooth, lighter than I thought, it didn't have that unctuous, almost greasy quality that I anticipate/hope for, then somewhat regret after eating like buyer's remorse.  In this case, I could finish the soup sans regret.

Now with another Ramen Restaurant in the Vegas fold, it's getting very interesting; people will decide their favorites, alliances will be formed, friends will become enemies, families will be torn blah blah blah....  I'm just glad that there's more choices, I already have my favorite list, but that's for another post!

Ratings (Out of Five Stars)
Food:          4
Ambience:  4
Service:      5

Beware of the shape of their bowls!

Hahaha. At least, I think it was the shape of their bowls. At first glance, it seems like any normal bowl of ramen, but as you stop to take a picture, the top of the soup cools down so fast that it becomes this thick goey texture. A quick stir of the broth and it will be gone, only to be back within a few minutes. Not exactly sure what it is... But something tells me it might be oil or some cartilage from the pork bones?

I had the Tonkotsu Ramen (soy), and the flavor of the broth was decent. I wasn't too big of a fan of their noodles (I prefer monta's thicker noodles). My broth came with a slice of pork belly (chashu), half of a seasoned egg, green onions, bean sprouts, and a piece of seaweed.  The pork belly was a really big slice, and had a good proportion of meat and fat.  I would have preferred a whole egg, but since it was included free with the soup, there isn't any complaints there. Everything else was pretty standard. If you wanted any extra toppings (which I did not get), they are available for an EXTRA charge. I say extra in all caps because in my opinion, some of them are a bit pricey.

I went with a friend who ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen (salt) as well as the karaage.  Her broth tasted a bit off, and there were black lines visible throughout. I'm not sure what kind of 'salt' they used, but I guess it was a type of black salt?(Update: I've been told the 'black lines' were from black garlic oil). Looked pretty odd to me. Oh, and her soup also had the thick gooey texture at the top if you let it sit for too long.  As for the karaage, they were pretty standard. Nice and juicy like they should be!

I would definitely be back to try more items on their menu, and I'll update my review then. For now, I give it 3 stars due to the weird thickening of the top of the soup. It wasn't really too appetizing to have to look in your bowl and see a solid layer on the top. =X

This is the go to place when I'm in the mood for ramen! My favorite is the Tonkotsu (Spicy). The girls there are always so friendly and the chef is nice. I love their reward system too! They give you a card and every time you buy a bowl of ramen, you get a signature and after your fourth bowl, you get a free appetizer! This place really is one of my favorites! Most likely will be making a stop through sometime this week!

The ramen is good, noodles are cooked fresh. The spicy tonkotsu is a great dish. There are two major flaws to Fukumimi unfortunetly. The portions, and the price. A slightly farther drive can yeild larger portions (double the size) of high quality ramen for a lower price ($1-$1.50).
Go to place on the east side of the town, very good soup, affordable, and good protion!

Alright Fukumimi, you've officially stolen my heart. For the LOVE of ramen! I'm so glad my boyfriend and I visited Japan 2 weeks ago, I can now suggest to eat at a ramen place anywhere, and anytime! My boyfriend wasn't very "ramen-friendly" before our trip. But now I know he appreciates the taste and flavor of ramen soup!

Lets start with the atmosphere, this place is just so cozy! We came here during a rainy day, and of course...I was in need of a ramen fix. Soup always sounds good on a rainy day. It's very limited seating, but you never feel clustered or overpacked when you come here. 

I ordered the fukumimi ramen which consisted of extra pork that was so soft once my teeth got a hold of the meat, seaweed (which I loved), an egg and the ramen noodles. May I add how flavorful the soup was? I felt like I was back in Tokyo! My boyfriend had the spicy miso ramen, which only had one pork meat (I ended up giving him a few of my pork meats, since I had a lot), an egg and the ramen noodles, but also had a spice on top. I got to try his, and if you're down for spicy- this will be good for your taste buds! 

Gosh, I could seriously eat ramen everyday and not get tired of it. I'm so lucky that fukumimi is literally down the street from me, I can come here any day of the week! See you soon fukumimi!
The best ramen in town!!! I had come once before and did not have the flavors or choices they have now. Had the spicy pork ramen and it was the best I have ever had....

Small little place but the food is good! Small size but will fill you up and with a good price you can get 2. The ramen bowls are a good size for a person to get filled up on. It's the little appetizers that are small. Everything we ordered was good. The only thing that I have to dock them on was the water! We all had white floating things in our water, they said it's from the ice. Either way it's gross. Even after replacing it we still saw floaties, we got pop instead.

It first time checking out Fukumimi Ramen. I could not think of better experience then sharing it with fellow yelpers for Elizabeth B. UYE. I did get lot of helpful hints about my newest Ramen experience since really either Monta but mainly Sora. Thankful that Francisco willing let me try piece of the Karaage. It really good. It small pieces of fried chicken goodies. The batter not too heavy or too light. Chicken nice hot and moist on the inside. Also ordered some kim chee was really good! It had just the right amount of kick too it! 

I ordered the Fukumimi Ramen. The broth was amazing! The noodles thiner and added different texture/taste too my ramen. Overall it was pretty good Ramen. Comes too the battle of Ramen still have too put Ramen Sora as my favorite! Monta and Fukumimi Ramen just as solid options! In the end the closest too the time always ends up on top and one not have too wait very long another leg up. 

Fukumimi okay size probably about the same size as Ramen Sora. They do have sitting area that can watch them make Ramen. Parking is not problem here because part of a decent little shopping mall. The whole staff did wonderful job of handling big party 12 yelpers in all. They kind enough too do separate checks for everyone. Staff supa friendly, helpful answering questions had for first timers like myself, and all yelpers some new yelpers meet. Good times. Thank you Elizabeth B. setting up Ramen night with great yelpers great company!!! Sure plan on coming back trying that spicy ramen.

The location of this place was a little difficult to find and not in the greatest area but I was determined to find it and try it after so many of my fellow foodies had given it great reviews. I also was hoping to find a good spot for my girlfriend and I to check out.

The ramen itself was satisfying but not amazing. The ground meat on top was served cold. I'm not sure if this is standard but it was a turnoff. But, after mixing into the hot ramen, it was ok. I also ordered it spicy and I could barely taste a hint of spice. The flavor of the broth was nice and buttery though so it was good but not great. 

The service was a little shaky from the start but what really left a bad taste in my mouth was when the server straight up asked if I needed ones for change. And gave them to me anyways and waited for a tip. This killed it for me because one, it wasn't the greatest ramen I've had and two, I really really can't stand when a server EXPECTS a tip. They really didn't do anything other than take my order to the cook. Literally. I know that sometimes servers get stiffed but that's part of the job. To take that out on an innocent CUSTOMER is worse than being stiffed, in my opinion. 

There are a plethora of other ramen shops so I'd rather not deal with the servers again. 

I would not recommend to my friends for the shaky service and the average ramen.

Tonkatsu Spicy Miso Ramen 3/5
It was ok.... the noodles were good but I felt like it wasn't enough. The meat was too chewy for my taste and I felt there was just too much broth to make your bowl look huge.

Service was great, the waiters came around and were attentive in supplying water. 5/5

If you come here during main dinner times come early, this place seating was a little busy as a few people had to wait to be seated. Luckily the turnover is really fast.

I would like to try the chicken karage next time but maybe not, I felt the prices were a little too high. It didn't help either that I went to gyu-kaku afterwards and saw a bunch of cheaper prices for their food on the menu. Price 2/5

I came here for the first time with my brother.  I had the Chicken karage and tantan men which is a Szechuan-style broth with a large meatball.  This was the first time I have had Japanese Ramen.  The broth is so spicy, hot, and savory.  I love coming to Vegas and trying new restaurants with my brother.  This restaurant does not disappoint.  In fact I craved it so much I came back here the next day.  I know I should have tried something else from the menu but my lunch was so good I ordered the exact same thing.  I recommend.

Tried the tonkotsu miso ramen and the honey garlic chicken. Very yummy! Service was good as well. Cute design on the inside of the restaurant. It is pretty small though so just have that in mind if you are a large party.

The best ramen I've ever had - hands down.  I'm not a big pork eater (haven't eaten red meat since 1986) - so I was happy to see that Fukumimi has a Chicken Ramen on the menu.  My first experience with restaurant ramen was in Little Tokyo in L.A. and lemme tell ya - Fukumimi blew that L.A. ramen out of the water.  

Fukumimi's broth was dense in flavor and the Chicken Chashu included in the bowl was well-spiced, flavorful and mind-blowing. Easily one of the best food experiences I've had in Vegas. Dangerously close to work - I asked for their punch card.  I expect I'll be earning a free appetizer a week!

Fukumimi has a great selection of ramen. The chicken ramen is great, my favorite was the kogashi with thick noodles. Compared with monta, jinya and sora, I think fukumimi's flavor is the best balanced ramen. Monta is awesome but I think their flavor can be a bit too concentrated. Fukumimi is very well balanced, try the kogashi! And the kurrage is amazing too!
The soup is too salty for me, but it is okay. One ramen is not enough for a man, so it's better order some appetizer.
This is my favorite ramen house in Las Vegas! Always delicious and always satisfying. The staff is always so cheerful and welcoming.

Okay this place and Monta are my favorite ramen spots. Not even going to compare them, they're both amazingly good.

We all kind of ordered different ramens and shared, so the only thing I could really tell you is that they hit the spot every time. Such bomb food, it's just a shame I live all the way across town. Ah, what am I saying, it's worth the drive!!

The noodle was not fully cooked and the soup was wayyy too salty. We ordered spicy miso ramen. 
At the check out, the waitress told us that we can get an appetizer for free bcoz we ordered 4 ramen. Duh, you should've told us when we make the order. I was very disappointed.

I was so excited to come here that I went alone. There was a wait. It must be good. Well, it is good. Although it was busy, the service was quick. My ramen was served quickly. I had miso (my fav) with nori ($1 add on). It already comes with corn and egg (very cool). I really liked it, but not as much as Sora's miso. I think it's because I'm a gross person that gets extra butter in it, no butter add on here, bummer. The ramen is great though and I would gladly pay for many more bowls of it. I have to go back. My pal Tetsuro says they have the best tan tan men in town, but they were out when I went (it was late). This place has more than just ramen too, like curry. You can also get kimchi (woot). Last but not least, the people that work here, all of them, are very kind, attentive, and genuinely asked me many times if I enjoyed my meal.

They have a generous loyalty punch card. Every 4 bowls of ramen gets you an appetizer. Yes!

I came here for the tan tan men.
Sadly, I ordered to go so I did not have the availability of the chilis and oil, available at the restaurant. 
It was soo heavenly! The flavor of the brother is so rich and complex with a nutty earthy flavor. My boyfriend loved it too! We will definitely be coming back. :)

I don't usually eat ramen, but this is one of the places that I'd go to when craving for ramen. The place is pretty small, but it makes you fee warm and nice. Feels like those ramen places in Japan in the movies. 

The food is good, affordable price for college student. I'd highly recommend this place!

A big fan. 

The eponymous ramen is the way to go. If a restaurant names a dish after itself, you order that dish!  And it doesn't disappoint, delicious chashu, perfect egg yolk, and by adding just a little white pepper, the salt broth is as good as I've found in Vegas.

I hate carrying punch cards but make two exceptions: Fukumimi and Buddha Belly Deli. The karaage is great here too and you get a free one with every 4 ramen bowls. 

See you there.

If you're looking for a very good new ramen place try, go to Fukumimi Ramen. I ordered the Fukumimi Ramen no joke it was the best ramen I've ever had. One sip of the broth and I was hooked. There are definitely so many amazing flavors going into it. Some suggestions I would give is to enjoy the broth before diving into the noodles, up to you though I like my noodles a little less firm they're still good. The pork belly was very delicious, let it soak into the broth you're gonna love it more. Nori pieces complemented it all. I wish I had more.

Fukumimi Ramen isn't that hard to find. It's not that far from the university, airport, strip, and a lot of business areas. It's located in a center on the NE corner of Tropicana and Eastern and just stands out with its funky Fukumimi Ramen sign and red banners in the window. It is however small inside and apparently people don't know how to park outside but there are a lot of parking.

I'm no ramen expert and haven't been to many "authentic" Japanese ramen places but Fukumimi Ramen has to be one of the better new ramen places to try. As I said it is small and new, right now is the best time to go before it gets more popular. There's probably only 5 tables and the bar area seats maybe about 5.
 
I've heard of their tantanmen, so you're next my list tantanmen I'm coming for you.

Try to avoid giving 5 stars but when a place meets every basic expectation for the price range and the food is unbelievable it's a 5.  Best. Ramen. Ever.  Fast, friendly, clean. Nice decor.  Can't wait to try everything on the menu!

Oishii! Would've given them 5 stars however my friend kindly requested no green onions and well...maybe it slipped her mind but there were tons of green onion in her ramen. When trying ramen for the first time I always taste the broth first. And this broth was delicious! I believe I got the regular tonkatsu ramen and was thoroughly pleased. We got there right before the rush and the other waitresses were really nice. All in all, I would come back. I also had their japanese curry, which I found to be really good as well. Comparable to curry house back home in Hawaii. Is it better than Monta? I'm not sure, Monta's fried rice and ramen combo packs a one two punch one that Fukumimi can't beat.

At first we ordered 4 soups & 2 gyoza.. then added the karaage last.. everything was good but the KARAAGE(chicken) wasn't fully cooked. Seemed as if they rushed to cook it. & IT WASNT BUSY AT ALL. we told our server, we literally opened all the chicken to show our server that it's still super pink & some of them you can tell it wasn't fully cooked. We don't normally complain but she didn't take the chicken back to cook it instead she fought and said oh that's just how our meat is. Really? Undercooked? Pink and raw inside? Yuck won't order that again... if you do order it, tell them to fully cook it!

WOW. i've striked the gold in vegas.
this ramen spot is pretty darn amaze. 
super tranquil tonkotsu soup with a hint of graceful spice for the tan tan mein. Owned and run by Japanese chiefs and owners, this ramen spot is a must eat.
it's a little ways off the strip, but its a great escape from the glutinous buffets of heart attacks.
I'm not the best person to comment on how authentic the taste is. But so far my taste buds liked the Fukumimi ramen! I'll try the other ramen options next time. :)
My favorite ramen place here in las Vegas so far. Staff is awesome, food is amazing and price is good. Must try the tan tan men and chicken karage.....sooooo good. Will come back time and again.

Heard about this place from some friends so finally had an opportunity to try it! 
Of course I ordered PORK BELLY. We also had Karaage, a side of Kimchi, a pork belly bowl aaaand another ramen but I can't think of the name of it now! It wasn't that great anyway... The Karaage (FRIED CHICKEN for those of you who DON'T know WTH I am talking about!) was really good! Juicy and awesome. I think they put extra sauce on the kimchi, it is REALLY good tho. NOM for sure! And my pork belly ramen was on point as well! Tender pork and delicious broth. NOM NOM NOM.

Who gets spicy ramen on a 103 degree day??? This girl...and her cousin-in-law Adriana lol

Both Adriana and I were craving soup despite being hot and humid during our visit to Vegas and our guys went along with the idea of going to a ramen spot because we were really craving soup.

I ordered the fukumimi ramen and asked for it to be made spicy and Adriana ordered tonkatsu ramen while the boys ordered curry and karage chicken.

The curry and karage chicken were basic...nothing out of this world delicious but not bad. I enjoyed my ramen very much...it was delicious and full of flavor. Adriana wished for hers to be more spicy so she asked for chili pepper powder to add to hers. She said it was good. 

I wouldn't mind going again even on a 100 degree day lol
Small venue, but big on taste.  Best of Las Vegas.  Away from the coasts these small places are hard to find.  Not perfect, but relatively fantastic!

We came here on a Saturday afternoon and to my surprise, we were seated immediately. Typical layout as far as the bar and the bench seating. Nothing new there. For appetizers, we had the gyoza and agedashi tofu. In hindsight, we should've had the honey garlic chicken but I enjoyed both appetizers nonetheless. I appreciated that the gyoza wrapper was thin as most gyoza I've had the wrapper was too thick. We ordered the spicy miso ramen. The noodles were good but I feel like there could have been more flavor in the broth. It also could've been spicier but that's personal preference. I don't typically add corn into my ramen but I'm glad this ramen came with it because now I'll probably add it to my ramen moving forward. All in all a good place to get a quick bite.

Wanted to try this place. It's located on Eastern and Tropicana. Beside Baskin Robbins. The place is a little small, seating maybe 30-40 people. The wait staff was friendly and helpful. I was told the Fukumimi Ramen was their top seller, now I know why... it was delicious. The broth was so tasty, Cha su pork was so tender. It had some sprouts, half an egg, and seaweed. Ramen noodles were perfectly cooked too. The broth was so tasty and rich. Contemplated on ordering another one while eating, glad I didn't, I was full by the time I got done. Probably, the best ramen I've had in Vegas so far. That's just my opinion though.
Prices were very reasonable. I will be back, and soon...

Tried to get into this place 12/17. Too crowded to get in within 30 minute; take out was going to take just as long as they wouldn't bother taking my order while seated customers were waiting for their previously orders dishes. Left without ordering. I can only guess that the food  was great from the long waits experienced.

I really like this place! I prefer this place to Monta Ramen, which is also good, but the broth here is more to my liking. I've had their Tan Tan Men and their Spicy Miso which are both delicious! You won't leave disappointed.
Ordered the soy ramen.  Did not taste the soy... I thought there was suppose to be soy milk in it? It's not bad but I've had better.  Waitress does not smile, kind of got an attitude.

Came back and really enjoyed myself again. This time I brought my bride. We were the first ones through the door when they opened up. Now my wife isn't as adventurous as I am but she finally settled on the chicken bowl. I pulled a classic me and ordered the same thing I had last time. The tantan men ramen. I also ordered the karaage chicken. Mostly for Laurie as I know she loves chicken. Our order was up hot and fresh in a matter of 5-6 minutes. I can't completely describe the flavors of my ramen other than to say it was so rich and wonderful, that I could easily make a slob of myself and eat 2 full bowls! The karaage chicken was somehow even better than last time. It was piping hot but so flavorful and juicy. I still really wish this place wasn't so far from my house. I will be back, and I will once again be hungry for ramen!

Just got done having dinner.  I had the Fukumimi Ramen bowl....delicious.  Added Kim Chi for good measure.  The had a ramen bowl with a Chasu bowl on the side.  Her side bowl was very favorable.   We shared a side of honey garlic chicken (also delicous).  I am very pleased with the meal and service  and look forward to returning soon.
I love this place it has the best ramen I've had. And the staff are all so nice. I highly recommend it.

OMG the ramen here is so amazing!  I initially stumbled upon this little hidden gem, because I was looking for a good ramen spot close to UNLV. Anyways,  I would say that they make top notch ramen. I would even say that their quality is right up their with Monta or Ramen Sora. Granted each place has it's own distinct broth flavor, but I'm telling you this place is bomb! I've tried a good portion of the menu and haven't been disappointed yet!  My go-to dish is the Fukumimi with thick noodles instead of thin and I add spicy paste! However, their Tonkotsu Miso, Soy, and Salt are all delish as well.  I like the Fukumimi because you get more toppings and I know they say that "less is more" but in this case "more is more" lol. Also the homemade kimchi, Chasu bowl, honey garlic chicken, and gyoza are all worth it!  Plus you can't beat the price!  If you're stuck on what to try, get the Fukumimi and gyoza.... then get a chasu bowl to go ..... they're great for breakfast!

I found this place out of the blue  thankful I hit the jackpot for a noodle restaurant . I ordered the pork pot stickers and spicy ramen. I can honestly say this is the best noodle house in town hands down ! Although its location isn't the best it's truly a hidden charm of delicious. I was so impress and delighted with my spicy ramen that I went home to tell my hubby all about it. I could not wait to take my family her for a delicious and affordable meal. The prices are really reasonable and the staff is friendly. It's a very small restaurant so don't bring a crowd. Hope u enjoy it as much I did.
Very good food. Was a little slow getting, but was worth the wait. Very small and crowded dining area. Would definitely eat here again when we visit Vegas.

This places stays busy. And you may have to wait a while for a table due to this is a smaller restaurant. That is the hard part waiting for a table while you are surrounded with such a wonderful smell of the food cooking.  Well worth the wait food is delicious.  Great friendly wait staff.

"Don't judge a book by it's cover" was right. Candidly, from the outside this place was as bit scary. The paint on the walls were discolored and it looked broken down. But I love places like that when they surprise the hell out of you once you're inside. You know what I mean? Like in movies when someone is walking through what they think is a deserted place but they go into a room and it's a freaking ball.

Nevertheless, I have to say that I still can't find a ramen place that's better than Jinya. This place was OK. Nothing special on the menu that you can't find at any other ramen joint and the food wasn't the best I'd had. I got the spicy miso...it was OK. And I also got a side of kimchi which I am SUCH a critic of. It's either good or it isn't. It wasn't.

All in all this place wasn't horrible but next time I want ramen and I'm on this side of town it wouldn't be the first to pop into my head. If I ever do find myself here again and it's better I will update my review.

I enjoy ramen here twice a week and love the taste!  I also frequent Monta Chaya and have to say these places are almost identical in their flavor profiles.  They have slightly nicer spoons at Fukumimi :-). The service is always top notch and I'm always looking forward to my next visit.  My favorite is the miso flavor with extra pork and egg.

YUMMMY! Love this place it's so conveniently located close to my home (finally a good ramen place close to the eastside!!) this place is cute but very small I'm sure once people try it this place will be super packed!!

Yelpers are losing their marbles trying to figure out what the best ramen is in Las Vegas.  I'm not here to tell you that Fukumimi is better or worse than the next ramen spot.  I'm here to tell you that I had quite a pleasant experience here, and I would recommend you to come check it out.

A lot of people recommend the tan tan men ramen, but spicy soups are not my style.  I went for the tonkotsu with soy I believe.  There is no menu online for me to confirm the exact name, but I got the soy based one as opposed to miso or salt or a spicier variation.  Chashu, green onion, and corn.  That is all I need.  I didn't feel like it was overly salty like some have mentioned.  I recommend the soy broth if you don't want to be so mainstream, delicious and simple, and more natural it seemed, as opposed to other flavorings.

The karaage is also a perfect appetizer.  It's like getting raisin canes from Japan!! (joke, although I am very fond of the Canes chain).

This restaurant will be successful.  The staff are very sweet and accommodating as well.  We were sitting next to another couple, and our server asked us if we wanted to move our table a little farther so we could have more privacy.  It's the little things, I like that.

Best ramen place in town! Love their menu. Been here a few times and loved it each time, they have yet to fail me. Service at this place is always efficient and courteous. As many times as I have been here too bad I still don't know how to use the chopsticks... kinda embarrassing, haha!

OH MY GOODNESS! I entered the place at around 2 after the lunch crowed it took me a little while to find the place, it is BEHIND wallgreens and next to baskin robbins. 
Fukumimi ramen- i got it with out the "fixins" i just got mine with pork and black garlic oil. I think they may have given me salt stock because on the Receipt said salt ramen so i'm not sure. But anyway the soup was very good very different then monta but just as good as monta to me. The pork OMG so I can't lie i'm going to have to say this places pork is better then monta, i know i know but it just falls apart and its SOO flavorful I had to order a extra order, that was 6 pcs all together, i know i was a little piggy haha!

I heard quite a bit about this restaurant and had high hopes for it but unfortunately I was disappoint in the food. Noodles were soggy and I feel like top ramen would have been a far better choice. The service was good which is why I'm rating this 2 stars.
Tasty ramen and very reasonably priced. Extremely small space so if they are busy be prepared to wait a bit, but food comes out quickly.

My bf and I always go to this location because its always conveniently on the way to where we were just at or where we're going. Its on the corner of Eastern and Tropicana near the newly built Starbucks/Baskin Robins. 

The place is kinda small but it never gets so packed to the point where you'd have to wait to be seated or served. Usually when you walk in, or the times I've gone anyway, we're immediately acknowledged by the server and immediately seated. Drinks usually come within the first 5 mins (or less) and our orders taken right away. I like how they don't shout the orders across the room like some ramen places do. I personally feel like thats a little tacky especially if it startles someone. 

Im all about that Tonkatsu Shoyu Ramen with extra egg and thick noodles. They serve a generous portion with an almost full bowl of soup. It comes with mushrooms, bambu, green onions, bean sprouts, meat, and everything else you can add on for an extra cost. My favorite thing about this place is how perfectly they cook their half boiled egg and the fact that their soup is not overly salty. If you're not a pork kind of person they also have other selections like the Spicy Miso which is what my bf gets. 

Their chashu bowl is also delicious if you're not interested in eating ramen. Their karaage is cooked to perfection every time but I'm more impressed with the little salad that it comes with. I can eat for days! Im not sure what kind of sauce they have on it but its delicious. Maybe thats something you can order if you're on some kind of healthy streak. 

Love this place! Worth a try especially now that its getting really cold. Also, thank you for the stamp card! We've gotten multiple things for free for how often we come here.

Currently, I am obsessed with Ramen so on my most recent trip to Vegas, I made a pit stop here on the way to the Strip. 
  Very friendly staff, I ordered the Tonkotsu and the DanDan Mien. Two huge bowls came. The Tonkotsu was very good, not as rich or as thick as my last in London. The Dan Dan was bad, peanut soup. I have had this preperation many places but in none was it soo nutty as to be peanut or sesame paste soup. 1 stars for the Dan Dan and 3.5 for the Tonkotsu. Nice noodles too BTW

Yum yum yum! 

So I've been trying to check this place out for awhile since it's pretty close to my office but there's always a line during lunch hours. A friend and I snuck in somehow and got tables by the bar. It's in a pretty run down shopping mall which makes for good parking lol!

We ordered and it took about 15 minutes for us to get our ramen but it was pretty packed. I got the salt ramen  which was literally perfection. Great flavor and tender pork. 

When our bowls were empty, we had to ask for our check twice then ended up just going to the front to pay. Service was shotty but I feel like that was due to how busy they were so I can't hold it against em. Definitely check out this spot if you're in the area.

One of the best in town easy. City wide it's tied for first with Monta but, this is the best ramen you can get east of the 15. This place is my persona favorite and I've gone atleast once a week for 4 months. No complaints. I get Spicy Miso ramen w/ gyoza and it never gets old

I've tried many ramen shops in town and this one is alright.  I've had their miso ramen and it wasn't really anything to write home about.  I'll continue to go to Ramen Sora for that.  Their non-ramen dishes are great though!  I usually got their curry bowl which is Japanese style (non-spicy, quite mild) curry with shredded chicken mixed in served on top of rice and some pickled plum.  I usually just push that off since I don't like it but no big deal.  Their garlic chicken is good as is their gyoza.

I like to give fair reviews so I decided to try this place out at least twice before reviewing. The ambiance is pretty chill, I sat at the noodle bar - I don't want to be that asshole who takes up a whole table when there's a line out the door of large parties. I really appreciate open kitchen views as well so no biggie. With that being said the ramen... sadly... sucks. I tried the Tonkotsu ramen my first visit... it was ok and the Tantan Miso my second visit. It was so bitter and lacked flavor. The oil coated my mouth and left a horrible lingering taste. They wouldn't let me add tofu since I don't eat meat in my soup so I ended up ordering the agadashi tofu which is where the two stars come into play. It was pretty solid. Also, the noodles were cooked quite well... there was a slight bite to them and not mushy. 

This place definitely has potential and obviously has great reviews. Maybe I came at an off day but twice in a row? The wait staff could be a bit more friendly. Maybe I'll give it another try just not anytime soon.

Finally I have made the trek to Fukumimi Ramen, and gladly so!  I came here with a few friends to try this new ramen joint, and was quite pleased with the results!  

I ordered the Tan Tan Men, being a fan of the version at Shuseki.  I have to say, this version was totally different and unexpected!  It had a sort of curry peanut soup base to it, along with chashu and bok choy.  The soup based had a fairly strong peanut flavor to it, and was pretty well balanced.  It wasn't spicy, which might have been a nice touch (I am not sure if it can be ordered spicy or not!).  The chashu was spot on.  It melted in my mouth while at the same time being a little meatier than the chashu at Monta.  Fukumimi really nailed the chashu.  

Overall I enjoyed my visit a lot, and if I am ever on this side of town I will definitely be returning!

Excellent! The staff is very friendly and their potstickers are the best I've had yet in the Vegas valley! It came out hot and fresh. The classic ramen is really good! Could of been a tad hotter even if it was hot, but still good.

Well. The place was clean. Staff were friendly. The ramen lacked umph. The broth had no flavor. After having Sora Ramen I was very disappointed at the quality of Fukumimi. I was hoping for another phenomenal ramen place closer to home but it was not the case. So for phenomenal ramen I will have to make the treck to spring mountain road.
When you're in the mood for some ramen this is the place.  The miso ramen is great don't forget the appetizers.

Small Ramen joint off of Eastern and Tropicana.  Busy,  but wait is not too long,  most people eat then go. Pork or Chicken based broth at perfect temperature,  won't ever burn your tongue.  Bite size meat pieces,  and additional toppings. Large bowl serves all orders.  Noodles are tender and filling. Friendly service and clean.
I love this place food delicious the only downfall is its tiny and always boiling hot in there makes it uncomfortable to eat

I was craving for some warm noodle soup and ended finding this gem.  It's a small restaurant with approximately 35 seating area.  I like that they have a simple menu to choose from.  I had their spicy ramen and it was full of flavor and just enough spice for me.  It definitely is a legit ramen place and I would go back again.

Came to eat here with my boyfriend and I'm so glad we did!!! The atmosphere was very relaxed, calm, clean and the staff are extremely nice!

We ordered the chicken to start off with (it starts with a k... karage? I totally butchered it up) and we each got a bowl of the spicy miso and the other spicy bowl of ramen (tankono? My spelling is horrible today) but regardless of my horrible spelling the food was amazing!!! 

The chicken was nice, crispy and extremely juicy on the inside. We both agreed that it was one of the most deliciously juicy chicken we've ever had. Our ramen were both delicious and fresh! The spiciness wasn't enough to get you panting and dripping sweat but it was enough to help clear both our sinuses! The noodles were fresh and had the amazing texture of freshness to it- not too firm but not too chewy and the egg in each of our soups were cooked to perfection! The broth of each soup was rich in flavor and mine had an extremely delicious creaminess to it- you can tell they cooked my broth for awhile to get the soup the way it was!

All of our food came out extremely quickly and the serving size was just right- enough to make you full but enough for you to be hungry for your next meal. Each bowl of ramen was about $7.95 to 8.95 which isn't bad at all for wonderful service and delicious food.

All in all, definitely coming back here again when we're near this side of town!!
Was greeted upon arrival. The food was really quick, the server checked up on is every 5 to 10 mins. The food was so good and it was really affordable. Highly recommend!

We heard about this place through a friend so we decided to try it. 

My first thought was that wow! This is a real hole in the wall place because it was so tiny (so don't come here when it's busy).

We ordered the fukumimi miso and I had the Kera spicy ramen. It was really good. Grandma ordered the chicken bowl which by the way is super tiny (good thing she has a small appetite). We also order the Japanese style friend chicken and honey garlic chicken.

Starting off with the spicy ramen, the proportion size was good, not too much and not too little. I really liked the taste of the soup but I wasn't a fan of the thick noodles. I enjoyed the boiled egg and the bean sprouts as well. They do include a thin meat in there (I think it's roast pork) that really went well with the soup.

On the other hand, the Japanese fried chicken was super salty! It looked really good but all I could taste was salt. I didn't think I would like the honey garlic chicken but I liked it a lot better than the regular fried chicken. The honey garlic was like a fried chicken with sauce on it. Really good.

I thought the ramen was pretty average here. The spicy sauces were nothing to rave about either.

The service here was great, much better than Ramen Sora, but sorry when I want good yummy spicy ramen, I won't be coming back here.

The chicken Karage was pretty good

Went to try this place out after reading  the reviews and I was not disappointed. Had the soy broth and it was hearty and savory. The ramen was not overdone, very tender and not soggy like other ramen spots. They are also very budget friendly.

Great place for Ramen.
I've been going down the menu trying them all.
They are all delicious.

The Gyoza (pan fried Japanese dumpling) are really goods as well.

Randomly found this little gem on my way home from work one day and now I get take out 2-3 times a month. Cheap delicious ramen that hits the spot every time. Spicy miso tankutsu is the bomb cheap tasty appetizers too. Nothing but good things to say about Fukumimi!

Tantan man with extra chasu & corn, throw in some spicy chili sauce. Karaage chicken & gyoza as apps. Ramen in it's finest form. Off the chain, for me. BF had the Soboro bowl, ground beef with green onions over rice. All was very good. 
Very small space & excellent service. Can often be busy. Highly recommend this Japanese Ramen restaurant.

CONDENSED IN A SOUP CAN: I'd go back in winter time with a glass of water.

THE MEAT: I would prefer to eat here at night and without a hangover.  When we went in the afternoon, the sun was beating down the side of the restaurant and we were sweating like pigs (if pigs did sweat).  We had the chicken karaage (not very crispy, but light and very tender), gyoza (wasn't too impressed with the filing), saboro bowl (savory sweet ground meat), chasu bowl (not bad), the tonkatsu salt and tonkatsu miso ramen.  

Normally I would complain about under-seasoning and pour soy sauce over everything, but this tonkatsu salt and miso broths were extremely salty.  The miso was definitely more flavorful than the salt version, and carried a spicy kick.  I didn't care too much for the ginger pieces and bean sprouts in the bowl, but the other elements were perfect - soft noodle strands, an almost cooked egg, thin melt-in-your-mouth chasu, scallions.  I wouldn't mind going back here especially since service is awesome, but for Hakata/Tonkatsu addicts, I'd still bet on Monta (their broth has stronger pork/egg flavors, bamboo shoots and wood ear mushrooms, Mmm).

I'M STILL DIGESTING... the fact that ramen broth chills to an almost gelatin form in the fridge.  Is there a gelatin component to this dish or is that pure lard?  I'm not so sure I really want to know.

WANT TO SEE SOME FOOD PORN? :-)
http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/fukumimi-ramen-las-vegas?select=O_FB7h1j6Ouw7Wy-YsWSGQ#O_FB7h1j6Ouw7Wy-YsWSGQ

Tiny little hidden gem near Flamingo and Eastern! Recommend! I had the spicy miso, which has thick noodles and my sister had the classic ramen (thin noodles). The broth in the classic ramen was very delicious and the thin noodles also went along with it. As appetizers, we had the karagee chicken and the kimchi tofu! Both were super delicious, but i can tell why the karagee is super popular amongst guest! So moist and so crispy!! Looking forward to bringing friends soon.

As far as a ramen place goes in town this place kicks everyone's booty by a mile.  It is waaaaayyyyyyyyy better than Anime Ramen.  The noodles are excellent quality, never tastes soggy, and I would almost say that it tastes like they make their own noodles.  But I'm not sure of that so I won't say it.  If you love noodles, it's an awesome place to go.  It is a bit pricey, considering it's ramen, but the servings are very generous so it makes up for that, and the fixings too.  

I can't recommend one thing on the menu, it's all good, just depends on your mood.

Yelp Review Matrix:

Type of restaurant: Traditional Japanese Ramen
Wait time: 0 minutes
Dish Ordered: Fukumimi Bowl, Honey Garlic Chicken
Quality of food: The ramen here is excellent! Very buttery broth that serves well as comfort food. The eggs and pork belly are tender and well made. The honey garlic chicken (a newer item) was a little too sweet for my taste, but I can see others enjoying it. 
Ambiance/Decor: the decor very casual, with a minimalist take on classic ramen shops.
Staff: staff was very courteous and attentive. 
Recommendations: Kaarage chicken for an appetizer and the Fukumimi bowl for you pork lovers.
Would I come back: Absolutely 
Would I tell a friend: Totes

I love to eat at Fukumimi Ramen when I'm on that side of town. Sometimes late at night I get a craving for their signature ramen (the Fukumimi ramen). I love their fried chicken appetizer as well. 

If you're thinking "ramen" and thinking of something you get out of the package for $1 at the grocery store, think again. This is the "real deal". The one I usually get has eggs in it, seaweed, amazing broth, delicious noodles, and pork belly (the best). 

It's a quick, cheap meal that will satisfy  you. I highly recommend.

Kara Miso is the way to go on a rainy day!
Service is great. Food is great. Garlic Chicken is the bomb.

Great ramen in Vegas is actually hard to come by but Fukumimi produces a very good product.  I've tried almost everything on their menu without any disappointment.  Their two chicken karaage options, gyoza, and agedashi tofu are the appetizers I would recommend.  All come fairly quickly when ordered, cooked perfectly, and taste great.  I've tried their extra fragrant garlic oil ramen soup, their tantanmen, and various additional types of ramen that they offer here.  All offer that 'just what the doctor ordered' feeling once you taste that first sip.

The star of the shop is none other than their Fukumimi Ramen, a pork-based ramen with thin noodles, seaweed, boiled egg, and an ample amount of pork chashu.  Other additions come with a small charge but may be worth it if you like such items as added corn, extra egg, extra chashu, or bamboo sprouts.  The broth is rich and salty but not over-the-top.  It's definitely soothing to the soul on a cold night but contagiously good that I would even eat it on a hot summer's day.  

I have even ordered to-go for work for myself and all my work colleagues.   The noodles come separately with the pork belly on top and a separate styrofoam container contains the hot broth ready to be poured onto the noodles.  The soup remains just as delicious as ever.
